hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Dawn Patrol Hybrid Shell Jacket - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Dawn Patrol Hybrid Shell Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Comfortable free ride contour fit. Fairly lightweight, stretchy fabric that maintains waterproofing, and great features like armpit vents and a secondary zipper with a mesh vent all the way up the chest.
review.name: Solid ski touring jacket

review.itemreviewed: Dawn Patrol Hybrid Shell Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I initially liked the Dawn Patrol shell when I received it in January 2024. I was looking for a waterproof winter shell to complement my trusty Patagonia GoreTex jacket, which I’ve used for several years. At first, the Dawn Patrol seemed durable and did a good job repelling snow. However, when I used the jacket again in November 2024—after only a few weeks of total use—it had already lost its water-repelling ability.

I tried reapplying a fresh layer of DWR, which helped slightly, but the jacket still let water through during long, snowy hikes when snow accumulated on the surface.

What disappointed me even more was the customer support experience. When I reached out, their advice was to reapply DWR again or send the jacket in at my own expense. They’d review it in 3 to 5 weeks to see if anything could be done. While these responses weren’t completely unreasonable, they felt below par, especially given the competitive market for outdoor gear.

In comparison, my 8-year-old Patagonia jacket still performs better than this one, even after years of heavy use. Unfortunately, I can't recommend the Dawn Patrol shell or Black Diamond based on my experience. There are simply better, more reliable options available.
review.name: Disappointed in Durability and Customer

review.itemreviewed: Dawn Patrol Hybrid Shell Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Roomy pockets for skins.  Water proof, quality.
review.name: Great coat for morning skin up missions.

review.itemreviewed: Dawn Patrol Hybrid Shell Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought it on sale. 5’9” 180 bought the large good fit. After reading reviews on the waterproofing, have not tested it out.hopefully this week with rain showers in the forecast. That’s is inportant in the PNW.
review.name: So far Good

review.itemreviewed: Dawn Patrol Hybrid Shell Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Fits well haven’t had a chance to test in the field yet!
review.name: Nice shell

review.itemreviewed: Dawn Patrol Hybrid Shell Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I am between a L and XL. 6’1 202Lbs. L was too small w a puff vest and transceiver and XL I have to roll back sleeve an inch. Otherwise lightweight and easily pacckable.
review.name: Sleeves too long

review.itemreviewed: Dawn Patrol Hybrid Shell Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: To be fair this is my first shell designed for touring but I love it, well thought out features for ease of use and functionality.
review.name: Great shell

review.itemreviewed: Dawn Patrol Hybrid Shell Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought this because I needed something last minute for a trip. This jacket has been beyond amazing. It's lighter and way more stretchy than my previous jacket. I even used it in a SAR op recently and it kept all the dampness out.
review.name: Amazing!

review.itemreviewed: Dawn Patrol Hybrid Shell Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Nicely made, loads of features. As previously mentioned, soft shell panels on the back and under the arms are not waterproof. So, this is a jacket for fair weather and spring ski tours.
review.name: This jacket has a specific use case

review.itemreviewed: Dawn Patrol Hybrid Shell Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought this jacket for a spring backpacking trip when temps range from 30’s to 50’s. This jacket served great as an outer shell in the cool weather. Very comfortable and flexible with great ventilation. Only con is the position of the pockets. The pockets are located in your breast rather than at your side. Overall great jacket for autumn and spring time trips
review.name: Great light jacket

name: Dawn Patrol Hybrid Shell Jacket - Men's

hasVariant.name: Bold Lite S Ski Poles

hasVariant.name: Bold Lite S Ski Poles
hasVariant.description: Buy the LEKI Bold Lite S Ski Poles online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I love these poles. Easy to adjust and fits every size wrist/hand. I've been using Leki Poles for years and I don't plan to switch. The other comment looks like the individual was incorrectly using the straps. Instead of putting the strap on and adjusting them before clicking into the pole, it looks like the person just forced their hand in the strap while the strap was already clicked in the pole.
review.name: Great poles!

review.reviewBody: I bought this days ago because I liked the grips better than cheap Scott poles.  Got it on the hill, and knew within a run that I needed to return them.  The strap was too small to easily get into when wearing ski gloves.  I ended up palming the straps the rest of the day.  On the second day (weekend trip, these were my only poles, had to ski), I walked my gear to the lodge where I noticed one of the straps was gone.  So disappointed.  I then decided to remove the other strap before I lost it too (still hoping for Lost & Found to come through), but it was so hard to remove.  I have no idea how one strap randomly falls off, and the other resists full effort to remove it.  I'm hoping I can find a way to get a replacement strap so I can return these poles.
review.name: Terrible strap system
comment: Thank you for your review, Oliver. We are sorry you didn’t find the Trigger Grip system to your liking. The oversized Trigger frame strap should fit comfortably over most gloves/mittens, so we are sorry that you found it too snug. Most users either leave the straps fastened over their gloves when not engaged with the poles or ensure they are locked into it when not in use. We appreciate that losing a strap when you are skiing is very frustrating, and we apologize for any inconvenience. We make many poles with traditional loop straps, so we hope you can find something more to your liking in our vast collection.

review.reviewBody:
Perfect design  easy on and off 
Front side favorite s
review.name:
The best for everyday skiing  
Quality poles

review.reviewBody: First trip with the Bold Lite S poles and they worked great in Alaska. The straps fit well around my gloves and the trigger release system is a nice feature. It’s simple to use, and adjust to from normal pole straps. The baskets were easy to change out as we needed powder baskets a few days. It also made it easy to fit the poles into my hard-sided SporTube by removing the baskets when putting them in with my skis.
review.name: First Trip with Bold Lite S

review.reviewBody: Poles are fantastic. Easy on/off system allows for quick strap clipping into glove and pole.
review.name: Leki Polez

name: Bold Lite S Ski Poles

hasVariant.name: Vermont Classic Spectron 3 Sunglasses

hasVariant.description: Buy the Julbo Vermont Classic Spectron 3 Sunglasses online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Vermont Classic Spectron 3 Sunglasses
hasVariant.description: Buy the Julbo Vermont Classic Spectron 3 Sunglasses online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought these ahead of some alpine climbs. Unfortunately, I couldn't use them at all and had to borrow someone else's spares. Without nose pads, the contact point is the lower edge of the middle leather piece. The Chams, a similar model, have nose pieces but they are prone to break off. Hoping Julbo revises these - I love the style!
review.name: Stylish but lack nose pads.

review.reviewBody: I bought my first pair of Vermont Classics 30 years ago at Teton Mountaineering in Jackson and keep renewing with prescription lenses. Backcountry is great.
review.name: Julbo Classics are the best

review.reviewBody: I have been in love with these glasses for two years, as soon as I opened the box I could smell the leather, from the side and nose piece cover, the temple pieces are an amazing balance of sturdy and soft, and the lenses have the perfect tint, unfortunately, as much as I love them I am about to return them, the glasses did not fit my face shape, I have very high cheekbones and the nose piece is not even close to resting on my nose, the leather side covers are the only part of the glasses holding them on, I really needed something like this, love everything about them but I need to go back to Asian fit frames :(   I would love more options and recommendations.
review.name: Heart Broken-dont fit face shape

review.reviewBody: This is the second pair I've owned. 1st pair was spectron 4 in the mid 80s for the high glare area I worked in. 2nd pair was last year spectron 3. For me perfect fit and not as dark. I have had many complements on the style. I wear them daily.
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: Like Heisenberg's fedora, these glasses are a critical component of my ego and persona.
review.name: I won't be seen in public without them

review.reviewBody:
I LIVE in these glasses when I'm mountaineering, on glaciers all day, and even day-touring. I also LOVE the retro, original style, and the history behind it.

100% recommend.
review.name: Love the classic style

name: Vermont Classic Spectron 3 Sunglasses

review.reviewBody: I ordered this for colder weather skiing since it's insulated.   Still has a light, comfortable feel to it, pockets in the right spots, and the color is cool and works with my flylow juniper colored pants..  I wear a lot of flylow gear to ski and have never been disappointed in the quality and functionality of it.
review.name: Sweet

review.reviewBody: This jacket is thin, but has a warm liner inside, which was perfect for a day on the slopes when it was 10deg.  Also versatile enough to wear on the slopes on a 40deg day. Is not bulky and very comfortable
review.name: Light and Warm

review.reviewBody: Great jacket. It's so soft and easy to put on and off because the liner isn't grabby like so many other jackets. The first one I tend to grab on an average ski day (20 to 30 degrees and minimal precip).
review.name: So Cozy

hasVariant.name: ARCON LT Knee Guard

hasVariant.name: ARCON LT Knee Guard
hasVariant.description: Buy the ION ARCON LT Knee Guard online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: ARCON LT Knee Guard
hasVariant.description: Buy the ION ARCON LT Knee Guard online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The pads fit true to size for me. They are a bit tighter than the medium 7idp Sam Hill pads but that made me hope they will fit for a longer period of time before stretching out. The pads are comfortable and I rode three times in them for a total of nine thousand vert of climbing with only very minor discomfort on the back of the knee.  The first fall was a slow fall and I fell straight to my right knee with little to no sliding and the seam above the knee cap separated a little. The second fall I had I fell on the right knee again at moderate speed and slid six or seven feet on my side. I was on my elbow and knee and didn’t tear the long sleeve jersey I was wearing but completely opened up the knee pad. Gave them three stars because the pad didn’t slide down my leg and they are comfortable but I wouldn’t recommend them because of the poor durability. Also wish one of these companies would put something smooth and soft behind the vented gel so when you do fall you don’t end up with abrasions from the holes in the gel.
review.name: Seam started coming apart in first crash

review.reviewBody:
Bought the size recommended by the size chart, measured my legs and everything. Way too tight. Could barely get on, extremely uncomfortable.

Seemed sick though. Would like to try again with next size up.
review.name: Runs 1 size small

name: ARCON LT Knee Guard

description: Buy the UGG Classic Dipper Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Classic Dipper Boot - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the UGG Classic Dipper Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Classic Dipper Boot - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the UGG Classic Dipper Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I don't get ppl who says they look huge. Yes, that's a style! Why do you even order if that's not your style? They are super cool and comfortable! Love ❤️
review.name: My favorite

review.reviewBody: Great fit and not too loose or tight around the ankle. The material at the top of the boot is more of a wetsuit material feels great and breathable.
review.name: I love them!

review.reviewBody: These boots are extremely comfortable. My feet love them, my toes are free for a change. They are definitely a righteous statement.
review.name: Yes, I buy again, and I recommend to all.

review.reviewBody: I ordered these in 2 different colors to wear with my bootcut leggings and pants. I cannot wear high heels right now and the platform adds the right amount of height for me to wear my pants that are intended for a low heel. Most of my friends gave mixed reviews about them--they do look vey big on--without a boot cut pant. I wear an 8.5 and I ordered them in a 9, as to wear with thicker socks if need be.
review.name: Very comfortable...

review.reviewBody: I'm a 7.5 in women and always get a size 7 in Uggs. These are true to size and fit perfect. I love the design and how you have added support from the upper sock-like portion. However, I do feel like if you have wide ankles and calves these probably aren't the best fit for you since they diameter is more restricting .
review.name: I loved it!

review.reviewBody: I read so many different reviews about them but when I received mine I was pleasingly happy I love the way they fit and look on my feet.
review.name: I love them!!!!!!

review.reviewBody: I love the platform.However the stitching across the foot is a but tight for wide feet people.
review.name: I would buy this product again.

review.reviewBody: I got the black ones first and then I got the chestnut week later I love themmmmmm.
review.name: Love them.

review.reviewBody: I made me a unique outfit piece with my UGGS loving the style
review.name: Nice platform I'm loving this unique design

review.reviewBody: These are so cute and stylish to me. I was afraid it would be uncomfortable because of the platform but they weren't. They are very comfortable and look cute with 2 piece sets of wide-leg jeans and yoga pants. I bought the black ones I think I want to get the chestnut color too.
review.name: It's a unique shoe but I love it

name: Classic Dipper Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: I've been using these for years. Main idea of neoprene gloves is that they stay warm even when wet. The wet layers actually contribute to the insulation.  And they work well.  Generally good down to about -10C.  Much more dexterous than most cold weather gloves. My latest pair aren't so well made tho - feel a little thinner, fit a little smaller & the stitching is starting to go in a couple of places after only a half dozen wears.
review.name: Less good than they used to be

review.reviewBody: I honestly love how the sweater. It’s very cute and soft. It’s similar to other Patagonia sweater so you get the same quality. Hopefully it’ll come on a lavender color soon.
review.name: Cute Sweater For Winter

review.reviewBody: I have the Los Gatos 1/4 zip in two other colors from last year. I purchased two more, in the same size, thinking I was getting the same fleece that I really love. Unfortunately, the sizing and style have both changed, and not for the better. The small fits much larger than those I ordered last year (wider, longer body, longer sleeves, higher collar), and the new style is also gathered at the bottom, which I do not care for. I will likely return due to these changes.
review.name: Sizing and style have changed!  :-(

review.reviewBody: This jacket is different than last years and the four others that I own - it is shorter and gathered at the bottom.  Such a disappointment - have to return?
review.name: Different style!

review.reviewBody: I bought this as a Xmas gift for my wife and she does like it, but wishes it had pockets. It is soft and cozy.
review.name: Do yourself a favor and order

review.reviewBody: The Los Gatos jacket fits me perfectly.  I'm 5' tall and weigh 108 lbs.   It's everything I hoped it would be - lightweight, with a high collar, can be worn with or without underlayers.  It also has the usual Patagonia sturdiness - well-fitting zippers, all the seams and borders well made.  I love the dusty blue color and also have the vest, in rose pink.  (The vest runs small, and I had to order a medium).  Highly recommend.
review.name: Soft, warm, comfortable

name: Los Gatos 1/4-Zip Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: Race cut, Giordana quality with zippered key pocket. I'm 5'9", 140 lb, Mens Medium Midnight Blue looks and fits great.  Not cheap.
review.name: Go-to summer jersey.

review.reviewBody: I'm 5'9'' with 42in chest and 32in waist and the size L fits perfectly.  I agree with all the positive comments from the other reviews.  Downside, you will have distinct tan lines of your bib straps on your back as this jersey does not block out sun's rays.  If you're ok with that, then this is a perfect jersey.
review.name: Excellent jersey for hot weather riding

review.reviewBody: First off, I love the color (mint green)and the jersey seems to be well made, typical of Giordana FR-C quality. It has a zippered security pocket which is a requirement for me. Fit is typical Giordana which means size up if you're even close to borderline on sizing. I needed an XL for my 40" chest as the L was just too tight. The fabric is a little different from previous Giordana jerseys I've owned and while not uncomfortable, I didn't feel like it permitted enough air flow on the hot summer day that I wore it. It would be fine for more moderate days.  Overall, a quality jersey but one I'll only wear in more moderate temperatures.
review.name: Nice Jersey with limitations

review.reviewBody: Chest size 38R and 29" waist, no gut.  Size S was very tight so I exchanged for size M which fits comfortably skin tight with plenty of flexibility for movement.  After wearing through the Texas summer on daily rides I am totally pleased with how the jersey feels and breathes.  This is my go-to summer jersey.  Worth every penny.
review.name: Great for hot weather

review.reviewBody: First time purchased Giordana race-cut gear and on sale.  Wanted something good for a duathlon, so I ran and biked in it.  While running I  saw a skinny shadow running beside me and thought someone was catching me.  Turned out to be me!  Medium is a skin-tight fit for me in all areas: arms, chest, collar, and just what I wanted and being race-cut this is what I expected. No flapping or loose areas at speed.  Stitching seems fine so far and fabric feels great.  Didn?t use the pockets for short bike leg so can?t comment on that.  This jersey is now part of my regular rotation.  I would buy again.
review.name: Feels fast and goes faster

review.reviewBody: First, switching from Castelli Aero Race 6.0 and  Rosso (my size is sold iut)... or attempting to complement my Castelli line, ordered a few FRC Pro on discount as they usually cost 100$ more than castelli. . First zip, look good, right size, a bit compressive but man oh man, it feels like sandpaper! or better yet, made in cheapistan poor materials. The pattern density is so low that it feels abrasive. In contrast, Castellis Roos, Race Aero, feel- well you cannot feel them! at 40 C 40 km /hr those are painted...  Silk like compression, no creases, smaller when unzipped vs the FR Pro, wraps seamlessly. PR delivered on the bike... The FRC Pro feel cheap, low end and its pattern is abrasive. Perhaps some may say, it airs better? Well, been riding in heat waves up to 45C, and I never had an issue with the Castellis.. The FRc Pro, unfortunately, did not pass the common sense first zip test...Now, contrast this with the FR-C Pro bib shorts, they are from a different galaxy. A baffling mystery why the FRC Pro jerseys are and feel so low end, on par with cheapies at 90$ from 2010, down to the same sandpaper material low density grid feel..
review.name: Deceptively cheap textile and pattern

review.reviewBody: Some details are different than in the pictures like mine came without the red around the arms and behind the neck. They should update the product images. Other than that is a great shirt good quality.
review.name: Some details are different

review.reviewBody:
I really like just about everything the Giordana FR-C Pro jersey offers.  It uses  at least four different types of fabric (not counting the waist gripper and arm grippers/trim), all of which are optimized for comfort and performance.  It has a deceptively simple design, with many solid, high-visibility colors available, but looks stylish in person, not plain.  The fit for me is just about spot-on:  trim but not tight; cut shorter in the front to prevent the zipper from bunching up when riding; longer (but not too long) in the back; the sleeves are the current longer trend.  The sleeve and waist grippers actually work well, offering a compressive/secure fit without pressure points.  In addition to the standard three pockets, there is a fourth zippered pocket for keys and small valuables.  

The overall quality appears to be very good (still made in Italy!) with no loose threads and great finishing to all seams.  Sizing seems pretty consistent with Assos and other European brands -- a little more snug than the Assos Mille in the same size.  All in all, the Giordana FR-C Pro is a strong contender for my favorite all-around jersey, among Castelli, Assos, Q36.5, Santini, and Mavic jerseys.  If it continues to hold up well, it might just be my favorite all-around jersey.
review.name: Great; a Real Quality Jersey

review.reviewBody: My first high end jersey.  Have a pair of FRC bibs that are also fantastic so wanted a matching shirt.  Nothing bad to say at all.  Quality, zipper, pockets, fabric, etc. are all top notch.  Sizing is a little weird.  I am 6'3" and 210lbs (but strong, not overweight--big upper body rather than a spare tire).  I have a XXL, and it is SUPER tight on the arms, shoulders, and chest.  Not uncomfortable at all though.  It is snug around the bottom half, but not in any weird way.  I would not want any bigger for my my waist or any smaller for my upper body.  Thus, XXL is the right size.  I will definitely order another one in a few months.
review.name: Great Jersey

name: FR-C Pro Short-Sleeve Jersey - Men's

description: Buy the Altra Escalante 2.5 Running Shoe - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Escalante 2.5 Running Shoe - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Altra Escalante 2.5 Running Shoe - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: These are amazing. My podiatrist told me to get a pair of foot shaped shoes and these are incredibly comfortable. I'm going to purchase a pair of trail runners.
review.name: Obsessed

review.reviewBody: And then I tried the Escalante 2.5 and now I'm completely obsessed! Gotta get another pair! Amazing from heel to toe!
review.name: I thought I loved altra torin

review.reviewBody: I am in love with the Superior 5, so I was excited for these. However, they are not durable (feel very flat after 100 miles). They have a narrow toe box, but it stretches out and makes shoe feel loose
review.name: Disappointing Durability

review.reviewBody: I love the Escalante 2.5, and can't wear the newer version. Please keep making this model.
review.name: Great Shoe for arthritic feet

review.reviewBody: My first pair of altra's and I loooove them! They're so comfortable, like clouds on your feet and the shape!! So awesome, my wide feet feel so comfy and my lame bunion isn't squished
review.name: Holy moly clouds on your feet

review.reviewBody: I loved these shoes at first. They were so comfortable, a bit springy, and I loved the stretchiness of the upper material. However, after wearing them for a few weeks I began to realize that my feet were noticeably rolling inward even when standing still. I think this was the combination of the stretchy material and the total lack of arch support. I began developing posterior shin splint symptoms. I prefer running in low-drop or zero-drop shoes. and I've never had problems with this before! I tried an insole, but it just didn't cut it... ended up having to return them. I think these are perfectly comfortable for walking and maybe even short running mileage, but they didn't work for me for any kind of distance training.
review.name: Beware: stretchy with almost no arch support!

review.reviewBody: The Escalante 2.5 is my favorite version of the show. It is getting harder to find, since you released the newer model. The new model is totally different & awful. I love this one and want to keep buying them :)
review.name: Please keep this older model

review.reviewBody: I have been wearing this shoe for about 10 years! I love it and hope they never change. They are comfortable from the beginning. I have a wide foot and they fit better than any shoe I've ever bought.
review.name: I would buy this shoe over and over

review.reviewBody: I have been a loyal Escalante fan since they came out. I'm sure I've went through more than 10 pairs over the years. This has not been a great model. For some reason, these feel more stiff than previous models, and for some reason the tongue on the left shoe started cutting the skin in front of my left ankle. I had to either fold the tongue over or wear taller socks. On a positive note, these have lasted longer than any version. Normally, I have retire shoes from running at 400 miles. These have almost 500 and don't feel any different, but like I said, they never gave me the spring in my step like previous models. There are no rips, tears, and soles still appear great...just like all of my previous models.
review.name: Least Favorite Escalante Version

review.reviewBody: I have been hesitant to buy new running shoes. I have loved the ones I had previously but they were no longer made (different brand). I have heard all good things about altra running shoes. Tried them on bought them and I'll never go back, in fact I bought 2 of the exact same pair so I'll be good for some time. I love having shoes to support my new running habit.
review.name: I bought 2 pairs the same day

name: Escalante 2.5 Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: It was not until I had already purchased a pair of these boots that I realized they are only compatible with tech bindings... It seems like it should be included in the list of specs/features, but no, it is not stated anywhere on this webpage. Cody Townsend uses and promotes these boots along side Shift S/Lab bindings, so the implication is they are compatible. You have to go to literally any other dealer/vendor, and there is obvious. It feels incredibly deceptive that the SALOMAN page does not make the extremely limiting characteristic explicitly clear. Otherwise the boots seem like good quality, but I will be unable to test them because they are not compatible with any of my bindings. Shame on who ever approved the specifics of this webpage.
review.name: Seemingly Good Boots, Ruined by Bad webdesign

review.reviewBody: I have been using this boot for at least 6 years. Last year I upgraded to this newer version. The boa works very well. I kinked one while working patrol and lifetime warranty got me a replacement. So I bought another pair since I work at two areas. The rubber vibram sole is very helpful while working especially if tower climbing is necessary.
review.name: Love this boot so much I bought a second pair

review.reviewBody: I love this Jacket. I’ve purchased  multiple times as my kids grow and get them the next size. Love the three in one option. It works for all weather conditions

review.reviewBody: Great jacket, very waterproof, works well for rainy days, warm ski days, and regular school days! Only negative is that the multiple zippers run my daughter's chin when they are all zipped up!

review.reviewBody: So far the quality seems good and the kids love them, but it desperately needs a highly-visible, decent-sized name tag to write at the very least a name if not a phone number. My youngest has already left it on the playground once.
review.name: Good but needs a name tag!

review.reviewBody: My son loves his new jacket and wears the inner fleece piece all the time because it is so cozy. It is a good looking jacket and very functional with the two jackets that can be taken apart and worn separately.
review.name: Great multipurpose jacket

review.reviewBody: My son absolutely loves this jacket. Very comfortable and the inner lining keeps him very warm.
review.name: Great Jacket!

review.reviewBody: Hard to get on/off and not as thick as expected.  Quality is good.
review.name: Not what I expected

review.reviewBody: Jacket is very nice and keeps my kids dry and warm. But after a month it already has a few tears - the fabric doesn’t hold up for very active kids.
review.name: Warm and dry but won’t last more than a season

name: PreCip Eco Component Jacket - Boys'

review.reviewBody: Fit is true to size, breathable and comfortable, the only boxers I wear!
review.name: The Best Boxers!

review.reviewBody: I got these before the Camino last year, hoping to find something that dried quicker than my Calvin Klein boxer briefs.  These probably dried quicker, but not by much.  The real problem was the fit.  Way to loose in the groin area, causing chafing on my first couple of days.  I got by with them by keeping them pulled up by rolling the waistband.  Not a great solution.  I should have bought them sooner and tried on some hikes around home before, like my other gear.  I won't make that mistake again.
review.name: do not fit well

review.reviewBody: Tried out a pair of these after experiencing durability issues with some very comfortable wool underwear from another outdoor company. The Echo boxer are lighter, more breathable, and just as comfortable if not more so. I ordered five more pair.
review.name: My go-to underwear

review.reviewBody: Was in a bit of a search for some new underwear that can do it all. I heard some good reviews of these and could not be happier. Great for running, hiking, lifting, lounging and super breathable.
review.name: The Real Deal

review.reviewBody: I use them for backpacking and travel. They fit well, are comfortable for walking - no thigh chafing, and they dry out very quickly!
review.name: Quick drying and good fit.

review.reviewBody: I got these in order to keep dry and cool while doing more strenuous hiking for wildlife surveys and while that held true for most of the day, in the end they fell a little short. I tend to be very sweaty so most moisture wicking only works for light to moderate exercise for me so I won't knock them too hard and they did hold up for the most part. But when they stopped being dry I ended up chafing which was painful.
review.name: Overall good, but didn't quite meet expectations

review.reviewBody: The Echo Boxer Briefs are not the snuggy huggy boxer brief that resembles compression wear. They are super comfortable and light boxer briefs with good support. This makes the Echo Boxer Briefs great for travel. They hand wash and dry easily and work as well under slacks as under hiking shorts. Probably would not choose them for a 50K, but will choose them for long hikes and backpacking -as well as business trips.
review.name: Worth Your Support

review.reviewBody: Bought one pair. Loved them. After a year I decided they were my favourites. Found more on sale but in a pattern that's less conservative than my usual. My wife loves them!
review.name: Very comfortable! Fast drying. Pleasing to females!

review.reviewBody: Every other pair I have ever owned seems to constantly creep up and give me wedgies. These are the right length to stay put perfectly and comfortably all day long.
review.name: These are the only boxer briefs I like

review.reviewBody: Great boxers for working out, hiking, travel and every day use. Definitely will be buy another couple pairs.
review.name: Super comfy, Super breathable

name: Echo Boxer Briefs - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I really wanted to like this sweater--it looked cozy in the wrapping and I could tell it would be warm. However, the angora color of this sweater is not the same neutral off-white pictured. It is much more yellow than in the photos to the degree I would call it a light yellow. Returning because yellow is not one of my colors, but how annoying that you pay to return things. I would've bought the other color if I had known what color it would actually be. 
Otherwise--definitely oversized, so size down if you want a more fitted look.
review.name: Nice sweater quality but weird color

review.reviewBody: Sizing accurate. Good feel to the fabric. Very comfortable.
review.name: Comfortable.

review.reviewBody: I bought this as more of a casual layer and it worked great not sure why it was so cheap. Better than its Patagonia counterparts. Light but warm. Looks good too.
review.name: Great Versatility

review.reviewBody: On a cool morning combine this 1/2 zip with a favorite t-shirt and you'll be all set. I look forward to using this layer on fall and winter hikes. I'm 5'10", 148lbs and the small was just right.
review.name: Great super-comfy layer

review.reviewBody: The Men's Summit Grid pullover is everything I expected based on years of experience with Mtn. Hardware clothing and gear. Well made, fits great, looks great and feels great. Warm while working well to relate overall temperature.
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody: I love this piece of gear. Great for those cool nights after reaching camp or mornings packing up. This is great for summer at 10k or winter with a jacket. Thickness is a little more than popular grids, but if I want lighter, I go with a typical sun hoodie. Toasty!!!
review.name: Great Grid Fleece

review.reviewBody: Nice fabric but totally off on sizing. I usually think MH nails it on sizing but this is awful. I'm 6'0" and 165 lbs. The medium has sleeves that fit well and is a little boxy but not too baggy, however it's almost a crop top! The hem sits fully above the waistband of my pants. I tried a large too, the length is a little better but then it's super baggy, basically wearing a tent. Total miss on sizing this time!
review.name: Awful sizing on this item

review.reviewBody: Perfect Pullover!  It’s my daily go to if I’m headed outside!
review.name: Pullover perfection.

review.reviewBody: Perfect pullover!  I find myself reaching for it all the time!

review.reviewBody: Excellent overall feel on these dynamic grips I just lovethem.
review.name: Excellent cushiest grips

review.reviewBody:
If you have little hands, get outta here. These bois are thiccc.

A few years back I think I googled "most comfortable grips" and these came up, and boy were they right. I was getting serious arm fatigue and pins and needles from harder grips and these were a game changer. I can't even imagine slipping a grip with these. I don't hold them, they hold me.

The rubber is softer than the unmentionable toys in your bedside table. I'm sorry for being crass, but it's true. I will cry if they ever stop making these.
review.name: Thiccc and supple

review.reviewBody: Perform well, very comfy but should have just stuck with black. Colors get real dirty really fast.
review.name: Might as well get black

review.reviewBody:
Was using the pnw loam grips which is slightly thinner, but i found the 34mm fit my medium sized hands nicely.

feel between both grips are quite similar but i do miss the flanges on my pnw as it reminds me if my hands has gotten closer to the bar
review.name: Grippy and cushy

review.reviewBody: These grips are great, very comfortable and grippy
review.name: Great grips

review.reviewBody: Love these. Wish they were even larger diameter actually. Loss of trail feel? Nah. Only for giants with big hands? Nope. I'm 5'8" and find these incredibly comfortable.
review.name: Supra comfy

review.reviewBody: Great grips.  They're grippy and cushy.  I don't like hard grips, I like a little cushion when I'm taking on chunky sections, and these grips are great.
review.name: Supracush = Supracool

name: Supracush Grips

review.reviewBody: I bought these gloves for my son, as they go out and clear company driveways when it snows. They keep him warm and do the job.
review.name: Best Gloves

review.itemreviewed: WP Insulated Knit Cuff Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: Keeping your hands warm in single digits yes, doing anything with them no , they'll fall apart quick .
review.name: Honest review

review.itemreviewed: WP Insulated Knit Cuff Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: The gloves are warm, but it's difficult to tighten one wrist strap while a glove is on the other hand. I have not yet had the chance to determine what they are like in the rain so I can't verify that they are waterproof as described. The nose wipe is convenient, but I'm not sure how how to clean it. It states online to clean by hand, but it seems like I should be able to machine wash them. I  also like that I can clip the pair together.
review.name: Gloves that should last

review.itemreviewed: WP Insulated Knit Cuff Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: You sent the questionnaire before my husband open his gift and he figured out what I got him for Christmas.

review.itemreviewed: WP Insulated Knit Cuff Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very good, I expected a touch warmer, but I'm in North Dakota weather so its extreme cold here.
review.name: Good/great!

review.itemreviewed: WP Insulated Knit Cuff Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: Hard to get on. small for the size. I take a large , Would not buy again
review.name: too small

review.itemreviewed: WP Insulated Knit Cuff Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great mens gloves,warm and cozy.Run a little small on size.
review.name: Insulated and cozy

review.itemreviewed: WP Insulated Knit Cuff Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Great material held up for the snow day
If shoveling. Hands were warm and dry easy grip to hold shovel
review.name: Good gloves

review.itemreviewed: WP Insulated Knit Cuff Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: Comfortable and a great design. Carhartt is pricey, but an ok price when on sale. They'll last for many years as I rarely wear them but to shovel.
review.name: A very nice rugged winter glove.

review.itemreviewed: WP Insulated Knit Cuff Glove - Men's
review.reviewBody: Gloves are great, in the Cold Michigan Winter's shoveling snow, staying out in the elements up to 20 to 30 degrees below Zero wind chill! Keep your hands warm for hours. Will not be disappointed, would recommend to family and friends.Overall best gloves i ever had. Thank you Carhartt,your reputation precides itself. I bought 2XL.Fit perfectly. Have big hands,and they fit to the tee. Picked black in color,have clasps to keep them together after use,and dry out quickly,before you put them away. Will buy another pair,when these are no longer useful. Nothing about these gloves I did not like. Keep up the great marketmenship!
review.name: Great gloves for Cold Climates!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] True to size, well made.  This jacket looks good and was exactly what I wanted.
review.name: Great Jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I'm 6'2", 165 lbs. The fit is spot on, with room for a long-sleeve and base layer. The warmth is perfect for layering or a stand alone. 4 out of 5 because it started pilling after the first wash, but otherwise, I'm stoked about the purchase.
review.name: Solid Fleece Jacket

review.reviewBody: The Marmot Drop Line fits and feels like a cozy sweater.  The moon river color looks great.  When I want to be casual and warm I take this sweater with me.
review.name: Fits & Feels Like a Cozy Sweater

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Jacket fit as advertised, super comfortable and built very well.
review.name: Solid Jacket

review.reviewBody:
I really wanted to like this.  The material and color were great, and the warmth was perfect.

Unfortunately, the sleeves were about 4 inches too long.  Also, the chest was too small while the belly/waist were too big.  It sort of tapers from wider at the bottom to narrower at the chest, which is weird (it should be the opposite).  I'm 5'9" , 145 lbs, and ordered the medium.  I previously tried the small, which was way too tight.

Poorly designed, or I would have kept it.  Too bad,
review.name: Sleeves built for an orangutan, not a human
comment:
Thank you for providing us with a feedback on our Men's Drop Line Jacket product. We truly appreciate you bringing the sizing matter to our attention.
We are very sorry to hear that the item has not fully met your expectations.
 
We will make sure to forward your idea and feedback of improving the items design to an appropriate department, so that we may think about an appropriate solution for the future. Thank you so much for sharing your opinion with us.
 
If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via  https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST
 
Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Warm and cozy jacket. Perfect for mid layer for skiing.
review.name: Warm and cozy jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Comfortable and warm -- ideal for cold winter weather.
review.name: Soft warmth jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice and warm! This was bought to replace my existing Marmot zip up sweatshirt that I have worn religiously since literally 2015. Nothing wrong with the old one still but thought I should expand my zip up collection. Good choice! It does feel slightly bigger on me than expected but still seems true to size.
review.name: Good purchase

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great quality product. I just bought it and wear it all the time.
review.name: Super nice fleece jacket!

review.reviewBody: I am not a fan of the material but it’s a great fit. I also like the dark color, goes great with jeans. I think this is more of a light fall top because it’s not overly warm.

review.reviewBody: Perfect for alpine climbing and getting harness on with both legs on the ground.

review.reviewBody: Much lighter than what I was using. Fit pretty well, but was a slight struggle loosening and tightening the belt strap.
review.name: Light weight!

review.reviewBody: This harness packs down to an amazing small size and is easy to get on diaper style while you have your ski/outdoor gear on .

review.reviewBody: Purchased this for a mountaineering trip coming up, I can already tell this will be the go to for many adventures. It is easy to get on and off with with all my layers; seems to have the right amount of loops and feels light and comfortable. I give it 4 stars because I need a little more time with it in action.

review.reviewBody: I purchased this for a Rainier climb and other ski mountaineering objectives. This is replacing my old Momentum harness due to its low weight and simple put-on and non-step-through features.
review.name: Ultralight

review.reviewBody: Perfect for ski mountaineering or glacier travel. Takes up almost no space in the pack & dries fast.
review.name: Small, light, effective

review.reviewBody: The belt is relatively easy to manipulate but (and this has been a problem with other BD gear I have) the plastic buckles are difficult to manipulate especially with gloves on. The other problem I have with this is the two front elastic straps are sewn in at the wrong angle and they rotate the harness crotch strap. It’s not really a problem but it’s a detail that would be nice if it was corrected.
review.name: Good Alpine harness

review.reviewBody: Light weight, genius design, has its own dedicated belay loop.
review.name: Light weight, genius design, has

review.reviewBody: Tiny harness! So much easier to pack in for long approaches to where you finally need to wear it. The gear loops are tiny and essentially weightless, so I wish BD had put four on there instead of only two.
review.name: Safety Lingerie

review.reviewBody: For anyone on ski patrol and have considered a harness for lift evacuation, the Couloir harness works perfectly. Easy to put on while sitting on the lift without dropping your skis. Nicely done BD!
review.name: Perfect!

name: Couloir Harness

review.reviewBody: After my previous rain paints pooped out after 20 years plus of service, I looked for their replacement. I found it in the Marmot Precip Eco Full-Zip Pant. Comfy, looks good, and gets the job done!
review.name: Happy Pants!

review.reviewBody: These are a great fit, and have kept me dry through many hours of walking and biking in the rain (for 3 weeks). If they stay this dry, I will be thrilled!
review.name: excellent so far!

review.reviewBody: How are these over? Fleece leggings I think hiking up the top of San Gorgonio Mountain. Hiking up San Grogonio mountain was cold and these pants kept me super warm. I wore them under fleece leggings. They also  protected me from the pokey shrubs that were overgrown on the South Fork  trail. For reference, I am normally an extra small in pants and a size 0 or double zero in jeans and I had the size up to a small in these.
review.name: Kept me warm!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Seem like very nice rain pants. Like the full zip, easy to get on. Haven’t had any rain since we purchased, but they seem well made
review.name: Great rain gear

review.reviewBody: Bought these on sale- failed to notice they were”long”. They are super long, like at least a 36 in inseam. I neede rainproof pants in a hurry for Alpine hiking, so I kept them
review.name: Rain gear in a rush
comment:
Thank you for providing us with feedback on our product. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.

We are very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations.

At Marmot, we strive for excellence and we set a high standard for ourselves, and we are so sorry to hear this was not met in your interaction with our brand. We greatly value our consumers' insights, which are collected and shared with our product development teams for consideration. We appreciate your effort and do hope that you will reconsider using Marmot products in the future.

We are happy to assist in resolving any issues you may experience with our products.

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST

Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great rain pants. Very satisfied. Waterproof and packable. The full zip was a must and worked great after some practice. Waist fit well over hiking pants. I got a size small short and it fit well. I'm 5'3", 120lbs, 26" waist. Only not 5 stars since they're not a goretex pant, but they got the job done well.
review.name: Great rain pant- Waterproof Lightweight Packable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great rain protection pants. I love the way they zip completely on both sides. That makes it very convenient to pull them off and on.
review.name: Great rain pants

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is my second pair of these.  I have not yet had a chance to wear them because the weather has been nice.  But what I love about them is that the fully separating zippers allow me to don and doff them without the need to tak my boots off and on.  Even more importantly you make them in a short length (I am only 5'1") and that is the ONLY way this concept works.  You cannot reasonably shorten rainpaints with a separating zipper--you have to start out with the correct length and not many companies cater to this need.
review.name: Rain pants that work for short women

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Liked the full-zip feature for ease of putting on over pants and boots, also the XS short length, for petite size women. I’m under 5 ft and weigh 92lbs. They covered the tops of my shoes without being too long. However, did not try them in the rain. Sadly, returned them, because the waist was too tight over other layers of clothes. A drawstring in the waistband could allow for a looser fit or option to tighten. They might have been great for the rainy days in the PNW in Oregon.
review.name: Women’s PreCip Eco full-zip rain pants-short

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My wife and I both own these rain pants and we love them.  I had to by a 2nd pair for my wife because she utilized her first pair almost daily when through hiking the AT last year.
review.name: Great gear!

name: Precip Eco Full-Zip Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are so warm and so comfortable for kids.  We buy them every time we need them.
review.name: Great Product

review.reviewBody: So much smaller than expected. Bought the large as other brands large ski pants were too big. My son could barely get the Larges up his legs and couldn’t zip them (usually wears 10/12 pants) so don’t know what was wrong.
review.name: Too small Larges
comment:
Thank you for providing us with a feedback on our products. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.
I am very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations.

We will make sure to forward your idea and feedback to an appropriate department, so that we may think about an appropriate solution for the future. Thank you so much for sharing your opinion with us.

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST

Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: Absolutely love these bibs, They are stylish and fit well and true to size. The best part is they have a tag on the inside stating when they get too short to un-hem the yellow stitching at the bottom of pant to extend another 2 inches. Great idea for kids going through growth cycles and allowing these to last more than one season!
review.name: Killer pants!

review.reviewBody: Great quality ski pants. The suspenders are a big plus.
review.name: Boys Ski Pants

review.reviewBody: Good quality. Adjustable length is great for kids that grow like weeds.
review.name: Great pants

review.reviewBody: Nice quality, but they will only fit extremely thin children, especially the larger sizes.  No sizes for shorter women or teens/preteens who aren’t extremely thin and tall seem to be available on your site... or really anywhere else in the outdoor clothing world.  The majority of people aren’t shaped the way your pants are. Chubby kids and short adults/teens like to play outside too!
review.name: Too tight

review.reviewBody: Great ski pants. They keep my kid warm and dry. He's worn them twice and says his legs are the warmest part of his body when he has them on. The "true fit" sizing feature on the website was helpful. We got the right size on the first try, even though my son is tall and skinny.
review.name: Great ski pants

review.reviewBody: Not waterproof. Within 30 minutes of being in the snow, pants become spotted with wetness. When we got home, I checked the inside. The insulated layer is also wet! Product is not as advertised.
review.name: Not waterproof

review.reviewBody: light and warm... perfect for winter outdoor activities
review.name: Kids’ Edge Insulated Pants

review.reviewBody: This is the 4th winter my son is wearing Edge snow pants. They hold up so well to a New England winter! 30+ ski days, playing in the snow, and school recess - these pants do it all! Worth noting, my son is very thin and these work for his frame. Between suspenders and velcro waist adjusters, they stay up!
review.name: Definitely a yes!

name: Edge Insulated Pant - Boys'

review.reviewBody: I really wanted to love these shorts but unfortunately they were nothing special and not functional as mountain biking shorts for my 8 year old daughter. Despite the description that they were mountain biking shorts, they were just like regular shorts. No chamois ( padding on the seat of the shorts) like I imagined there’d be and the only reason I’d even ordered them.  The print is adorable and they fit my daughter great, but we returned then because she needs a true mountain biking short with a built in chamois. I wish I had read this review before I made the purchase.
review.name: Not what I expected

review.reviewBody: I like the flexibility of this wetsuit. I’ve also had the O’Neill hyperfreak wetsuits. I think Maneras wetsuit is more flexible and I liked the color too. The 3/2 kept me very warm. The front zip helps keep the heat In
review.name: Nice wetsuit with good flexibility

review.reviewBody: Really nice suit. Unfortunately, it's not long enough for my height. I was skeptical that the size guide said a medium would fit a height range of 5' to 6'1". It's stretchy, but not thaaat stretchy! I think this is better suited for someone 5'-5'6". Also, I'm a pear shape and the medium was a tad too tight in the limbs/hips. Maybe I will try the shorty version instead.
review.name: Too small for me

review.reviewBody: Most amazing suit that stretch pretty well, high quality and awesome color that won’t fade!
review.name: Most amazing suit ever!

review.reviewBody: Purchased this a month ago and it's been great.  Warm but not too warm.  Worn casually and mountain biking and does what it should.  As usual, great pricing and fast service.
review.name: Patagonia Jacket

review.reviewBody: I bought this for my partner after many envious comments regarding the one I've had for years. It's his go-to layer for cool Summer nights/breezy beach days and perfect now for Fall.
review.name: Cozy, versatile layer!

review.reviewBody: I really like pretty much everything about this jacket and wear it almost every day. One of the few things I don't like is the length of the sleeves. Granted I am short and got a larger size the normal so I can layer with a merino wool shirt and a flannel underneath, and it runs a little slim like the description says. The inside material of the jacker is a pet hair magnet. Other than these two things I really enjoy everything else about the jacket. Nice and breathable but still keeps a decent level or warmth with it being such a thin mid layer.
review.name: Almost perfect

name: R2 TechFace Fleece Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody:
For the sidewall these use  Kenda's SCT (SCT)
TUBELESS AND TOUGH Kenda Sidewall Casing Technology (SCT) is the modification of existing Kenda tire construction methods. By adding an additional sheet of Nylon fabric across the sidewall of the tire, from bead up to tread block, it results in the optimization of the tire construction for fluid based tubeless conversion systems. Additionally, the SCT construction increases the structural strength of sidewalls; bolstering resistance to slices and abrasions, helping reduce the chance of catastrophic damage that fluid sealants cannot seal. 

The Regolith can deliver elevated levels of wet and dry performance with acceptable wear characteristics.

Cheers!
review.name: Product detail I wanted to share

name: Regolith 29in Tire

hasVariant.description: Buy the HOKA Transport GTX Shoe - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Fit and comfort a 10. Design accents a 0. I do not understand how anyone could design a shoe with accents that show on the side sole appearing to look like dog feces with confetti sprinkled in. I would love to know what I can use to cover up this so-called accent on the side of the soles. Surely I cannot be the same customer with this reaction when they open the box.
review.name: I would buy this product again but not this design.

review.reviewBody: I bought these thinking they would be the same as the Transport except waterproof. I was wrong. They don't fit the same, being much narrower than the original Transport. Back they go with the easy return process. I'm glad I tried them and now I know.
review.name: Not Like Transport

review.reviewBody: I use these sneakers for work and really appreciate how they don't make my back hurt after 8 hours of standing! They stay dry and have good traction, exactly what I was looking for!
review.name: Comfortable and Versatile!

review.reviewBody: I've been using Hokas for the past 10 yrs at least, the best shoes ever. This particular one is great to match with my scrubs at work.
review.name: Love love these shoes

review.reviewBody: These really are waterproof-just came in from a 20 minute walk in the wet grass and pouring rain and my feet are totally dry. Shoes fit snugly true to size. Hoka usually fit me a bit larger, but these work for me. They're comfortable and supportive. They're not a cushiony feel with the goretex, but they serve my needs really well for daily dog walks in the wet grass-and sometimes rain.
review.name: Waterproof!

review.reviewBody: I work in Healthcare which is standing for 8 hrs or longer. This shoes are comfortable and I like that no laces are needed.
review.name: Will be purchasing in different color

review.reviewBody: I tried going up half a size since there is no wide fit but it still hurts my toes so badly. Please make one with a wide width option. I am a medical professional whose on her feet for 14-16 hrs per day and I won't be able to last in my shift wearing this shoe if my feet hurts. :(
review.name: I love the style but I need a wide width option

review.reviewBody: I bought these shoes for travel to Europe during raining season along the Finland and Norway Coasts. I was going to be doing a lot of walking and weather forecast showed possible rain almost every day... but thankfully we had minimal rain on our outings; but when it did rain these shoes were fabulous! They did their job and my feet stayed dried and comfortable! My heel is on the narrow side and my toe box is borderline b/c width. I have several pairs of Hoka tennis shoes but this was the first time I had bought the Transport GTX. I was skeptical of what the material would be and how they would look when I ordered them. To my surprise they look like normal tennis shoes, but yet they were waterproof! The water just beaded up and my feet were dry! No Scotchguard or spray is needed! And while the fabric is a bit different, it is very resilient and I loved that my shoes stayed clean and looked nice my entire three-week trip. Honestly, they still look new! I can easily walk 8-11 miles a day when traveling and exploring, so I wanted the "Hoka" comfort... I got it! I bought these last minute mail order without testing or wearing them and left for my trip a few days later. There is no breaking-in needed... they were comfortable from day one and off I went. My feet never hurt and the fabric did not make my feet sweat or be hot either. I will say the bottoms are a smoother texture and I would not say these would be the best for hiking, I like the sole more rugged for hiking, but they worked perfect for me walking and exploring the city! I wish I had found them for previous travels. Being waterproof is really nice; you never know when it is going to rain and to have this protection AND comfort at the same time is fabulous without taking extra shoes. I usually do take 2 pair of tennis shoes, just for change of pace and color, but I highly recommend the Hoka Transport GTX! They will for sure be in my suitcase when I travel to my next destination.
review.name: These shoes are awesome for travel and unexpected rain!

review.reviewBody: I took two pairs of these on a tour of Iceland where weather can change from sunny to rain in the same day. Recommendation was to have waterproof shoes. Fortunately I didn't have any downpours to deal with but they were comfortable for all of the walking I did. I will use them in the winter when it's wet and not a lot of snow. I tried these in a shoe store before ordering online and I was told to size up a half size.
review.name: Great for Iceland Trip

review.reviewBody: I love the fit of these shoes; a bit more narrow than the original Hokas so fit me better.
review.name: Love it

name: Transport GTX Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: looks POC only designs for northern european people. Their helmets are narrow and longer front and back. Not like other brands they design and manufacture for asian fit.

review.itemreviewed: Obex BC Mips Hedvig Wessel Edition Helmet
review.reviewBody: It's fine. I am sad that it gives me a huge headache. I am usually in the middle of medium, large and X-large helmets. POC offers this in M/L, and XL-XXL. Shred's L/XL helmets fit me better in the past. With my 58.5-59cm head, this helmet is too small while also wearing a buff. So if you have the same size head as me, and wear a buff or head bandana, get the XL-XXL.
review.name: Its good, Runs smaller. Gives headache.

review.reviewBody:
Very good boots, just breaking them in.... which is definitely needed.
Bought them for an Artic Trek !!
When purchasing ensure you use the measurements guide; I'm a 5 and needed a 6.5...

Recommend company as returns service good.
review.name: Great boots

review.reviewBody: Les pires bottes que j'ai acheté. Elles se déforment TOUJOURS au niveau des orteils et m'empêchent de marcher. Salomon m'ont envoyé 2 paires de remplacement et même problème à chaque fois!
review.name: Pire achat ever
comment: Nous vous remercions pour votre commentaire sur la TOUNDRA PRO CLIMASALOMON™ WATERPROOF. Nous sommes désolés d'apprendre votre expérience avec le gauchissement de la zone des orteils. Nous prenons la qualité des produits au sérieux et vos commentaires seront partagés avec notre équipe pour un examen plus approfondi.

review.reviewBody: I got to try them out today, they were great in the freezing cold but a bit stiff.
review.name: Great boots

review.reviewBody: La première paire a eu le même problème, avec les coutures qui se défont. Seulement 1 an d'usure pour ma 2e paires, je prends seulement des marches avec et les coutures de l'avant pied se sont décousus des des bottes. Concernant li niveau de chaleur, ce n'est ps -40. Elles sont froides, j'ai les pieds gelées avec ses bottes, elles prennent l'eau. Je ne les recommandent pas du tout. Je les ai reçu en cadeaux et je suis très déçu, Salomon n'ont plus la meilleure qualité de produits.
review.name: Coutures de défont à l'avant-pied
comment: Nous vous remercions pour votre commentaire sur le TANDRA PRO CLIMASALOMON™ WATERPROOF. Nous sommes désolés d'apprendre votre expérience avec les coutures qui se détachent et les températures froides que vous avez rencontrées. Nous prenons la qualité des produits au sérieux, et vos commentaires seront partagés avec notre équipe pour un examen plus approfondi.

review.reviewBody: They are a little stiff in the upper part but that provides good ankle support…I ordered my usual shoe size going on other reviews that said they run true to size…they are a bit on the roomy side for me but I don’t have time to exchange for another size as I need them for my job. Good traction. My only real complaint is that there seems to be very little or no insulation on the bottom of the foot bed so if you tend to have cold feet (like me) or you stand around for any length of time in cold temps, your feet will get cold. Overall, I do like them, though.
review.name: Good boots

review.reviewBody:
I used these all hunting season in the snow. My feet never got wet. They are lightweight and comfortable to wear. It took only one day to break them in. 
I should have bought my actual size, but went up half a size thinking I would need it. For future customers, I would say buy the size you normally wear. These fit very true, even with thick socks. 
Overall a great boot though. My feet got cold at times, however I was not wearing thick socks and they were a touch on the big side. 
I needed them immediately so I was unable to send back for an exchange in sizes.
review.name: Good boot

review.reviewBody: This is my first pair of winter hiking boots that are warm and comfortable without being bulky. They also have excellent arch support. Often, I put hot pocket warmers in my boots, wool inner soles and/or bulky wool socks. I no longer need those items. The temperature has only been in the single digits or teens thus far, but I'm comfortable and happy with my purchase.
review.name: Comfortable & Warm

review.reviewBody: Always a great shoe to use, take lots of punishment but stays strong. This is my second pair, after walking most days and wearing the first for many year. Salomon always a brand of note worthiness.
review.name: Toundra Pro

review.reviewBody: Après 3 hivers à être portées à tous les jours du mois de novembre au mois d’avril, dans toutes les conditions possibles, je vous confirme que ce sont les meilleures bottes d’hiver. Entièrement imperméables, très confortables à -30oC comme à 0oC. Les tailles sont généreuses (j’ai les pieds larges). Parfaitement adaptées aux hivers canadiens.
review.name: Meilleures bottes au monde!

review.reviewBody:
I’ve been wearing for a few years now and hike a lot in the white mountains of NH winter.  These boots are toasty on the feet.  Sometimes a little too much.  I tend to wear a thinner sock if it’s above 0.  My first pair last amazing for the amount I hike and was very pleased.  So I bought a new pair.  They had a
 Seem defect  about 11 months in and not wearing to much.  I reach out at they credited me for the boot. The company is outstanding and so are the boots.
review.name: Holy warmth and comfort

name: Toundra Pro CSWP Boot - Women's
Toundra Pro CSWP Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: Keeps my head warm. I have been using this under my kayak helmet for the last three months, it has kept my head nice & warm.
review.name: Fits nicely under kayak helmet

review.reviewBody: I love it.  Keeps my head warm.  Lightweight and comfortable!
review.name: Lightweight and comfortable!

review.reviewBody: This is my daily work beanie. Its lightly weight but warm and a nice snug fit without being overly tight. Great for under a helmet or a stand alone.
review.name: Nice lightweight Beanie

review.reviewBody: Yes it’s tight but that’s how it was designed, fits great under helmets and hard hats
review.name: Noggin

review.reviewBody: I'm buying 5 more of these to have when someone decides to change the design and ruin it by making it bigger.  Perfect for fitness adventures, the AM skin, and wearing around town, you can throw a baseball hat or helmet over if desired too. Stocking up!
review.name: Perfect Fit!

review.reviewBody: Unless you have a child's size head, don't buy this. It's listed as a 'unisex' (not really sure what that means for hat sizes) but this small. . . like kids version small. I wear average size hats (i.e. not large or extra large) and this barely got over my ears. Very disappointed that something could be this mis-sized. Stay away - our you'll be faced with paying ~30% of the items cost in return shipping so that you can find something that will actually fit.
review.name: Can we talk about how small this hat really is? Did someone make a kid's size and forget to tell anyone?

review.reviewBody: Had two of these earlier, lost them. Lovely fabric, soft and warm. Used to come in two sizes. New Regular size is *very* small, may fit a kid. I keep my head shaved (no hair), and this one covers the top half of my ears when pulled tight. It slowly creeps up to the top of my ear over a minute or so, which is incredibly annoying if you are active outdoors. MH, if you are listening, make them bigger. Or at least bring back a large size!
review.name: Too small, loved early ones

review.reviewBody: Pretty basic warm hat, not itchy, other colors would be nice
review.name: good hat

review.reviewBody: Fits well under my helmet and is warm. Had decent moisture wicking capabilities
review.name: Works great

review.reviewBody: They are designed for very small heads! Do not recommend unless you know you've got a teeny tiny head.
review.name: Very small size

name: Power Stretch Beanie

review.reviewBody: I have been wearing this layer under my down suit on Everest and other 8000m peaks, under softshell pants in Antarctica, and under hardshells ice climbing in Alaska. One of my favorite pieces of kit and the best on the market for its category. It has changed how I layer my legs. Synthetic insulation on much of the leg and then the lower part is basically like a classic long underwear and it fits great inside your boots.
review.name: Most Underrated Layer on the Market

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Got a matching pair for me and my son. We love them. They look great. Super comfy. Dries much faster than most swim trunks. The zipper pocket is helpful.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These swim trunks fit perfectly and look great! I received multiple compliments after my first wear, so I’ll definitely be rockin’ them more often.
review.name: Great fit

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the pattern, and I can't wait to use them next summer!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Keeps the junk in place and fit great, can’t ask for more.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are Christmas gifts we are going on a Florida vacation so we will not use them until March. both son-in-laws and all 4 grandsons love this brand.

Highly recommend the lined swim trunks for the fellas who get bothered by chafing the first few days walking around the beach on vacation. XXL for me works, I bounce between 36-38 waist.

review.reviewBody: It's been a month since my daughter is wearing Enkka sneakers. They fit comfortably, they are really waterproof, and you can go hiking in morning dew, and feet will stay dry. Color matches most of her styles. We are very glad to have them!
review.name: We love them!

review.reviewBody: They fit nicely the first day and after a few wears they are sloppy and loose. The elastic around the back ankle is 'ruffled' like elastic that did not go back to its shape. :( this is the case for both the shoes I bought for my 2 sons.
review.name: Shoes stretch after first use.

review.reviewBody: A little bigger than expected, but that's ok! He loves the colors because they're just like 'Dad's shoes.' Haven't tested out the water proof yet, either way they're a good show for fall.
review.name: Cool shoe

review.reviewBody: Nice shoes, there is nothing Finland about these though other than the name, unfortunately they are made in PRC
review.name: Pretty good

review.reviewBody:
Best shoes my son is 6 years old as a parent we struggle to fine shoes for him
He all ways complain , with this sneakers
First try and the shoes were so comfortable and now he doesn’t want to take them off great shoes thank you
review.name: Excellent sneaker

review.reviewBody: My 10 yo son asked if I had rated those shoes 5 stars and I hadn't at the time. He said 'I can jump higher in those shoes!' I am very happy to hear the approval. I also love the colors, the design, and the quality.
review.name: 5 stars!

review.reviewBody: This shipping was quick. The shoes seem like really good quality but they are just not wide enough for kids with even moderately wide feet.
review.name: Nice quality shoes, not for wide feet

review.reviewBody: I will never get this pink coat again when I tell you scam I would of returned it but my daughter wore it one time and never wore it again thank you I wasted 130 for nothing

review.reviewBody: I love this one my son loves it happy I atleast didn't wast my money on two coats . I definitely get this again

review.reviewBody: Bought this for my son and it is very warm and comfortable!
review.name: Great quality

review.reviewBody: Super cute style and color. You can feel the warmth immediately by sticking your arm in. My toddler loves it and even on a warmer day chooses this coat.
review.name: Toddler approved

review.reviewBody: Love it so warm but not too bulky nice big pockets, excellent buy for the price.
review.name: I would definitely rebuy this coat

review.reviewBody: Again... she hasn't worn it yet. It's been too warm for a winter coat
review.name: Will buy again

review.reviewBody: Comfy and warm. Always appreciated a good product and North Face is just that!

review.reviewBody: This is a very warm coat. It is also suitable for children. I will buy it again when I can no longer wear it.
review.name: Buy again

review.reviewBody: I was very excited to order this coat for my granddaughter's second birthday, thinking she could get at least 2 years wear from it. The coat color is very pretty, but the quality and size are questionable. It looks like a parka coat on the website, but is more of a down coat in person. The size is on the smaller side, I'm happy that I have another granddaughter that will be able to wear it as well.
review.name: I would not buy this coat again

description: Buy the Canada Goose Lorette Black Label Down Parka - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Lorette Black Label Down Parka - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Canada Goose Lorette Black Label Down Parka - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Lorette Black Label Down Parka - Women's
review.reviewBody: I purchased this to wear in frigid Michigan weather, and long days at the base of a ski hill watching my two daughters downhill race. It is by far the warmest coat I have ever owned (and I have owned A LOT). I can get away with just one thin base layer underneath and I stay toasty warm. The features of the Lorette are really nice; toggle buttons and leather trim at the cuffs. I bought the Graphite color and it is beautiful in person. I love that the fur hood has wire inside it so you can mold it around your head and neck to keep out the wind. I also love the "back pack" straps inside so you can take it off inside and wear on your back without having to carry on your arm or put it down. Definitely worth the price for the quality and more. I get a ton of compliments on it. It is exactly what I wanted!
review.name: Great investment

name: Lorette Black Label Down Parka - Women's

review.reviewBody: For price, durability, and dependability, Ultegra is the way to go.
review.name: Standard in the Industry

review.reviewBody: Ultegra CS R8000 rear cassette is a great cassette. It’s the only cassette I use, I have just done a Dura Ace R9100 upgrade on my Evo and I use this cassette due to durability and price.
review.name: Evo upgrade

review.reviewBody: Closely spaced ratios make it easier to hit my targeted power and cadence levels during interval training, without resorting to erg mode.
review.name: 14-28 - perfect for a smart trainer

review.reviewBody: For training and racing this is the one.  If you have all the money get the dura ace. If you are self sponsored go with the ultegra. I'm getting 5000 miles out of them. So I go through two dura ace chain's for each cassette and the shifting stays crisp.  Big chainring at 10,000 cassette at 5000 and chain at 3000. Your results may vary depending on cleanliness
review.name: Nothing beats ultegra

review.reviewBody: 11-25 Ultegra R8000 works perfectly, even with my long cage ultegra R8000 rear deraillure.  Seriously works PERFECTLY!
review.name: Ultegra R8000 11-25

review.reviewBody: This is the best performance and value   If you have all the money you need,, then by all means get the dura ace. I go through two or  three a year so the ultegra is for me.
review.name: Best all around cassette

review.reviewBody: I've been running same cassette for 10 speed, 11x33, and NEVER A PROBLEM. Probably 25,000 miles on the old one and looking forward to the same with this one, on new Pinarello Prince. Never had a problem with any Shimano product and all products are both mechanic and user friendly!
review.name: Shimano 11 speed 11x32 cassette. FANTAST

review.reviewBody: The ultegra cassette is the sweet spot in the price/weight/durability spectrum of shimano (and other brands) cassettes. My go-to for training and racing. I ride about 8k miles/year
review.name: better than good enough

review.reviewBody: High quality, light, easy to install, good price, smooth shifting and comes in a wide range of tooth options.  I use the integra cassettes on both my ultegra and 105 rigged bikes; bought this one for a gravel rig I am building.  No complaints ever.
review.name: Still the best

name: Ultegra CS-R8000 Cassette

review.reviewBody: Show your love for cats in the most masculine way and snatch these up! This is my first pair of SockGuy socks and I'll be back for more. I wear a size 9.5 in most my shoes and decided to go with the S/M size just because I like a snug fitting sock. These have been awesome for warm weather rides but I don't hesitate to throw them on for the cooler months too. I've received many compliments and that's even before they realized there were cats on them. Wear these kittens and you'll feel smitten!
