hasVariant.description: Buy the Louis Garneau Fit Sensor 5.5 Short 2 - Women's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Fit Sensor 5.5 Short 2 - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Louis Garneau Fit Sensor 5.5 Short 2 - Women's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I got these on sale, so I think they are a great value! The chamois is very comfortable, on par with expensive shorts. After washing, the legs roll a bit but bad like cheaper shorts. The fit is super comfy!
review.name: Would buy again!

review.reviewBody: Bought the navy blue in a size small.  Fit was perfect.  Liked the shorts after a couple of rides, so I bought the gray ones - same size.  Could not get the gray ones over my knees, let alone pulled up due to being so small.  The fabric is also completely different - rough with no stretch.  Very disappointed the sizing and fabric are not consistent.
review.name: Not happy

review.reviewBody: Runs small the fabric is thin with little stretch. Runs very small. I loved the LG carbon 5.5 shorts this is more cheaply made. Chamois is little thicker than a tri short. Not good for cycling over a few miles.
review.name: Not as good anymore!

review.reviewBody: I love these shorts that I bought 2 pairs. My favorite part is that they don't choke out my thighs. They fit my waist perfectly but allow my legs to not be overly constricted.  I've tried several shorts where the bands about the thighs are too tight and down right uncomfortable if you're legs are thicker than your waistline. Total win for me.
review.name: Love these bike shorts!

review.reviewBody:
I've been using these Garneau shorts exclusively for years. I'm always the same size: 5'8"  and 145lbs. but initially I had to wear a LARGE because they ran so small. Then, they redesigned them and suddenly I had to wear a SMALL. Now they redesigned them again and I finally wear what I should have been wearing all along: a MEDIUM.
But in this redesign the medium is a little short in the waist, the shorts don't come up enough. In my opinion they've been cut too short from the crotch to the waist. What a shame.
I wish Garneau would make up its mind on what to do with these shorts and stick with it, they are on the right track now, but the sizes need a little tweaking. They are otherwise wonderful shorts.
review.name: Great shorts.... But...

review.reviewBody: Purchased 3 pair of short (5" inseam) shorts from my wife as a gift. This pair was her favorite, PI and more expensive LG shorts were returned. She preferred the pad in this short and also liked that it does not have a noticeable leg gripper which bothered her on the other 2 pairs. She wears these for indoor spinning classes and outdoor riding.
review.name: Wife love's em

review.reviewBody: The bottom half of bicycling togs I purchased for my wife. She noted that the padding works well and the outline isn't too bad (for bike shorts), but these shorts lack any "gripper seam" along the leg holes, which allow them to creep up her admittedly skinny thighs while riding. I'm surprised about that oversight given the price.
review.name: Feels nice, but legs ride up

review.reviewBody: These are my new favorite shorts! I love the shorter inseam length is super cute and just right for me. I also love the pocket on the outside of the leg - it fits my iphone11 no prob. The padding is really comfortable for me and these are my go to shorts for long rides and short rides. I also find the waist and legs openings to be comfortable and not too tight like some shorts are. I am often an XS, but these only come in a small. I feel like these run true to size. I would have tried an XS if it was available, but the small fits great and is very comfy. I would recommend these.
review.name: Love these shorts!

name: Fit Sensor 5.5 Short 2 - Women's

description: Buy the Merrell Siren 4 Thermo Mid Zip WP Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Siren 4 Thermo Mid Zip WP Boot - Women's

hasVariant.name: Siren 4 Thermo Mid Zip WP Boot - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Merrell Siren 4 Thermo Mid Zip WP Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Siren 4 Thermo Mid Zip WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Needed new boots for daily dog walking in bush. These boots were True to size,  Comfortable and warm. Handled the terrain beautifully especially through ice and snow.
review.name: Happy dog walker

review.itemreviewed: Siren 4 Thermo Mid Zip WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I'm very disappointed in these boots. After a few days, my ankle hurts. Repeated use has not resulted in any comfort.
review.name: Disappointment from longtime Merrell fan

review.itemreviewed: Siren 4 Thermo Mid Zip WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Great well-made lightweight boots. Nice looking waterproof and warm because they are waterproof. I always order a half size bigger so that I can wear comfy thicker socks, and put some type of an orthotic or extra arch support.
review.name: Great boots

review.itemreviewed: Siren 4 Thermo Mid Zip WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Warm, comfortable, good fit. Sole is great on icy sidewalks and snow.
review.name: Stylish and functional

review.itemreviewed: Siren 4 Thermo Mid Zip WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Best hiking boots ever. They're so comfortable, durable, and keep my feet warm. Even wore them in the rain and they still look great.
review.name: Love 'em

review.itemreviewed: Siren 4 Thermo Mid Zip WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is my 2nd Merrell product and it does not disappoint. Superb comfort and warmth. This is my brand!
review.name: Excellent product!

review.itemreviewed: Siren 4 Thermo Mid Zip WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have 2 pairs of shoes and a boot that are the Siren 4 which fit very well and are comfortable. Unfortunately, these boots were a full size too short and no larger size was available to purchase.
review.name: Too small

review.itemreviewed: Siren 4 Thermo Mid Zip WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have only had these boots for a short while, but my first impression of them is very favourable. They are comfortable, with good arch and ankle support, and my feet stayed warm for the several hours that I was wearing them.
review.name: Warm, comfortable and supportive

review.itemreviewed: Siren 4 Thermo Mid Zip WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These Siren 4 Mid Zip Waterproof are an option that holds a bit more on the walking surface because of the sole bottoms. I bought another pair of Merrell boots with a flatter bottom for different use. These are great for cool, wet days. I find them quite comfortable, like the zip (and do need to undo a bit of the lacing too — but it’s nice to have both as it makes on and off faster. Have used for walking the dog and doing errands. Have been warm enough, though I didn’t buy for cold weather per se. And it’s been rainier rather than snowy. Love that they are waterproof.
review.name: Grab the surface waterproof boots
comment: Thanks for sharing your great feedback!

review.itemreviewed: Siren 4 Thermo Mid Zip WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Lovely, warm & comfortable. Love these boots. Currently keeping my feet dry in the UK!
review.name: Lovely, warm & comfortable.

name: Siren 4 Thermo Mid Zip WP Boot - Women's

description: Buy the Black Diamond Spinner Leash online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Spinner Leash
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Spinner Leash online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Great piece of gear. Leashes aren’t for everybody, but if you need a doubl leash, make sure you get one like this that spins.  My one concern is that I don’t know it’s beak strength. I hope it’s low enough to not get pulled down by an ice fall, I do trust BD but I find it strange that it’s not rated.
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody:
I will likely try these again but I bought a set at Michigan Ice Fest last season. One of the biners bent so the gate doesn't close on the second climb on the first day using them.

First time I have ever been disappointed with a Black Diamond product in 20+ years.
review.name: Biner bent on second climb

review.reviewBody: Light, small, well made, “just works.” I get the “leashless” idea I just can’t imagine risking dropping a tool.
review.name: Another great bit of BD gear!

review.reviewBody: Nice light weight leashes. Locking 'biners help these stand out from the competition. The elastic is low resistance--almost unnoticeable. The black color contrasts well with most ropes, making it easy to avoid messy tangles when following.
review.name: They Spin

review.reviewBody: If you need a leash this is a good option. Screwgate biners securely attach to your tools. I am not a big fan of climbing with tethers but in certain situations dropping and axe is day ending event or worse. In those situations this leash from BD is a solid option.
review.name: Solid option

review.reviewBody: Spin and lock as advertised. Give me more trust I’m not loosing my tools.
review.name: Work great

review.reviewBody: Do their job. Would be nice to have these offered in full strength so they could be used in anchor building.
review.name: Do their job. Would be

review.reviewBody: What you see is what you get really. They work perfectly fine.
review.name: Does the job

review.reviewBody: I have poor circulation so I'm always worried that my fingers will go numb and I'll drop a tool. These leashes give me peace of mind that they'll never land on my belayer or leave me with 1 tool to finish the climb. They leashes are a bit long, however, and do get caught on bulbous ice or occasionally tangled with the rope, so you have to be cognizant of where they're at as you move up the climb.
review.name: Peace of mind on ice

review.reviewBody: The spinner leash is just a bit longer than the old model of this leash system. The extra length is great because it gives enough room to move without taking away my reach. The carabiner attachments are more than you need but the carabiners offer great security for the tools. The swivel also helps the leash from getting tangled while leading.
review.name: good upgrade from the old style

name: Spinner Leash

review.reviewBody: Nice light shorts with a good pad, I like the length just above knees
review.name: Perfect mtn shorts

review.reviewBody:
The major flaw in the design of this short is the manner the inner liner is attached to the outer short. It is basically hanging by a single string on either side, thus it always comes out of the wash in a tangled mess. I ended up just cutting the attached strings and using it as a separate liner, which works ok as far as that goes. 
As far as the outer short, it is made out of some chintzy polyester material with a cut that would fit right in at the Boca Vista estates where Jerry Seinfield’s fictional parents lived.  It wound up in the garbage.
review.name: Poor Design, Chintzy Material

name: Canyon Short With Liner - Men's

hasVariant.name: Bark Ranger Kickstand
hasVariant.description: Buy the Burley Bark Ranger Kickstand online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Bark Ranger Kickstand
hasVariant.description: Buy the Burley Bark Ranger Kickstand online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Perfect stabilizer. Never knew I needed it till I had it.
review.name: Kick (stand) It!

review.reviewBody: My dog loves going for rides in her Burly. She goes out in the garage to sit in it, which is where the kickstand comes in. Keeps her from flipping over when it isn’t attached to a bike.😀
review.name: Bark Ranger

review.reviewBody: Easy to install and makes the Ranger much more stable when stationary. Training on getting in and out of the trailer slowed down a bit after adding the wheels since, even with the breaks on, it was a little wobbly. Added the kickstand and the trailer became a place to hang and relax. He even started going into the trailer on his own to relax! (See pic)
review.name: Helps cautious dogs feel more comfortable getting in and out of the trailer

review.reviewBody: The kickstand really helped out during training my golden retriever to get in the wagon. The kickstand kept it sturdy enough for her to enter and exit. When my bark ranger XL is disconnected from my bike, I’d rather use the kickstand, then moving the wheel to the down, lock position, or taking off the trailer arm.
review.name: Needed it more than I thought

review.reviewBody: Glad I bought it, I have installed it on the back to support my pups weight when she gets in and out. She’s more confident getting in and out when I use the kickstand.
review.name: The kickstand is a great addition to the Bark Ranger

name: Bark Ranger Kickstand

review.reviewBody: I find these leggings very comfortable and warm. They fit closely enough to wear them under another pair of trousers. They are well made. I have several pairs of them.
review.name: I find these leggings very

review.reviewBody: Extremely warm and I've never had to wear anything else when I'm out and about. They've been a good fit and over several washes not pilled at all, which is great.
review.name: keeps you warm and after several years does not pill

review.reviewBody: Ordered RAB leggings - not as well fitting as previous pairs - tight on calves and seam tends to twist around - very disappointed with the fit this time
review.name: Ordered RAB leggings - not

review.reviewBody: Quality does not seem the same. I have had these for over 10 years p
review.name: Quality does not seem the

review.reviewBody: Warm, comfortable and reliable . I have invested in these in the last 4 years and they stand the test of time!
review.name: Warm, comfortable and reliable .

review.reviewBody: Have worn Rab Power Stretch pants regularly for several years, They are really comfortable and great fit.
review.name: Have worn Rab Power Stretch

review.reviewBody: This is my third pair in 3 years. Lovely and warm and I wear them virtually all the time in the winter. Fit is quite good (size 8) but I wish they were a bit more snug in the thighs. I would have given them 5 stars but over time they do become a bit baggy especially at the knees. I have looked for alternatives but can't find anything that does the job as well. I usually wear them on their own for dog walking etc but when it is very cold I wear them with warm overtrousers.
review.name: This is my third pair

review.reviewBody: Very happy with my purchase they are a perfect fit, very warm and comfy.
review.name: Very happy with my purchase

review.reviewBody: So warm and comfortable. Just done a walk and it was -3 at top (810M) and my legs were warm. note wasn’t windy that day. During winter I wear these all the time, when dog walking, up hills etc. I even wear them at home now we have reduced heating to save money. They wash very well on 30c. and shape up nicely
review.name: Utterly amazing

review.reviewBody: Comfortable and flexible.wonderfully warm travelling around during a Finnish winter
review.name: Comfortable and flexible.wonderfully warm travelling

hasVariant.description: Buy the Giro Chrono Sport Knicker - Women's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I like the chamois, it's well padded for road biking.  No seams that chafe (a problem I've had in other tights).  I like that it looks clean and basic, no big logos, no reflective details in weird areas (another brand I looked at had reflective tabs right under the butt cheeks, why?), no shiny fabric or random mesh panels.  The fabric is thin, similar to fabrics used in shorts.  Not fleece lined, which is good for me because I wear these in warm weather to protect from the sun.  It's very clean looking and comfortable.  Size is accurate, I wear size small in most brands (36" hips. Size 4 in Lulu).  My only complaints is that at 5'0 they are a little too long and the front does roll down a little when I am bent over.
review.name: Comfortable and good looking

name: Chrono Sport Knicker - Women's

review.reviewBody: Excellent bag for gym and general use along with work brief case. Plenty of pocket and zipper options. The only recommendations I would make is having the main clothing compartment a hair bigger/fatter and changing the design so that is stands upright on it's own,..or leans back on a wall vs falling forward.

review.reviewBody: Loved how it worked! Great storage capacity. Only thing is that it lacked a bigger main compartment.
review.name: Awesome, only have 1 critique

review.reviewBody: Needed a backpack that was versatile. I have long day hikes with a good amount of gear, but also cross country flights for which I want a space for my laptop and a puffer for when I land. This backpack has done it all.
review.name: Solution to multiple needs - versatile and comfortable

review.reviewBody: I like the sleek design of it, as well as every pocket being useful for something I carry around in my day to day life.
review.name: I would recommend this product to a friend or family member

review.reviewBody: I dearly loved the previous version of this backpack. I'm disappointed that this one has less actual volume and less usable volume than the previous model.
review.name: Less volume and less usable volume than the previous version

review.reviewBody: I replaced a competitor's product. This is how I carry papers, documents, reading material and the usual assortment of office supplies. Lots of separate pockets and slots make this a joy to use.
review.name: New work backpack is great!

review.reviewBody: I bought this pack in 2012 and finally after 12 years I am buying a new one because my business colleagues tell me that it looks scruffy. It must have done 20+ laps of the world and still works great.
review.name: I would buy this product again and again and again and....

review.reviewBody: Overall good. Water bottle pockets are too tight. I wish this was a touch bigger like the pack that replaced it. But there was only one option for 35l and not my style. Pocket layout it good though.

review.reviewBody: Typically, this is my work "briefcase." Great pockets to separate items.

review.reviewBody: Surge is a classic, durable, comfortable backpack with plenty of storage, including a padded laptop sleeve. It's perfect for daily use and its water-resistant fabric holds up in light rain. While not designed for heavy hikes, it's a reliable choice for everyday carry.

description: Buy the Kask Protone Helmet online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Protone Helmet

hasVariant.name: Protone Helmet
hasVariant.description: Buy the Kask Protone Helmet online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I really like this helmet but the cushioning pads at the back of the helmet fell out on one side after about ten rides and the hard plastic is very uncomfortable against my bald head without them.  I hope I can get some more pads to replace the ones that fell out.
review.name: Nice helmet - cushioning pads fell out

review.reviewBody:
The Protone caught more than a few sets of eyes when it was first unveiled. And it has lived a fairly long life for a single iteration of helmet, helped in part by the fact that Team INEOS (ne, Team Sky) continues to sport the lid year after year. Well, it caught my eye not long ago, too, when I found myself in the market for a helmet again. So I got it. I like the compact shape (it doesn't make me look like a mushroom). I like the balance between aero and vented design (tasteful). And there's one simple ingenuity that really gets me feeling warm and cozy about Kask: it's that pleather or naugahyde chin strap the company adds to avoid salt encrusted nylon webbing from rubbing the neck raw. What a simple but beautiful design detail. Somebody was thinking & logically, helpfully, and with the rider's best interests in mind. I think of photosynthesis, the invention of the ball bearing, or Benjamin Franklin hanging a key from a kite in a thunderstorm. Good, wholesome stuff to have with us. And so I really have only one bone of contention about the helmet.

There are engineers out there fueling the industry with bold plans on how to implement the next cog, for stepping up the performance of battery powered shifters, and creating apps for your smart phone that allow you to arrange the buttons on your levers just to your liking. Beautiful actors will demonstrate how badly you need these in your cycling routine. And yet, the bicycle persists as chiefly a mechanical device, and enjoyed by us all tremendously for the fact. Aside from that, it's the naugahyde chin strap that really makes you happy on your twenty-five mile burner after work. First and foremost, there's the riding of the bike, and then the little improvements along the way. Now what Kask needs to do is invent a soft gutter system that can be embedded in the foam pad that hugs your forehead when the helmet is on and cinched down. Really, why hasn't someone figured out a way to channel sweat away from your brow and down your temples? I saw a shot of Sagan in the Tour de Suisse this year sitting up in his saddle and spraying down the lenses of his sunglasses with his water bottle, and I felt a kindred spirit. The Protone just dumps it right beside the bridge of your nose, and soon enough you've got a river of brine flowing across your field of vision. Kask, please make this new sweat diverting invention for the padded inserts backward compatible so that I can get it for my Protone.

There are some elite cycling apparel companies that just now are touting proprietary designs in men's bibs that introduce a pocket-like feature in the chamois that gives your bits resting room up front without compressing them with an unforgiving lycra panel. Duh! It could have been done decades ago. But those companies feel it necessary to introduce the design as though they were leading some kind of brilliant revolution in fit and comfort. Meanwhile, Kask quietly introduces a simple chin strap that makes it more comfortable to wear your helmet. I hope they do the same, in the same fashion, sometime soon for a dribble proof foam head band in their helmets. That will be a revolution.

As for the flimsy plastic cradle pieces in the back that some reviewers have experienced breaking after time, mine are still intact after several months. Touch wood. They are flimsy. But still doing their job.

Long term update: Still a dribble cup. Can't find pad replacements. One of the little plastic cradle pieces broke.
review.name: Head Mounted Dribble Cup

review.reviewBody:
Out for a 26-mile tune-up ride yesterday, my front tire blew during a fast descent. When I went down, I felt my head bounce on the road. The Protone had a scuff on it and a few hours later there were two bruise lines on my forehead matching the ribs of the helmet, like the seat belt bruising you get when they do their job in an accident. It definitely kept me from having a much more serious injury.

I've used this helmet for about 3 years. It sits lower on my head, a little above my eyebrows, which helps protect my head and face. Yes, at least on the older styles, the rear retention system did bump the arms of my sunglasses. I've been wearing a thin beanie under my helmet for sun protection and that gives enough gap in the retention system that sunglasses comfortably slip underneath. Overall, it's one of the best fitting, most comfortable helmets I've worn. The chin strap and buckle is really a luxury.

My complaint is with the rubber "pad" strips on the rear retention frame. Over time, they've come off in bits until I just peeled that last inch off. It doesn't affect comfort or fit without them; they just weren't very durable.
review.name: Saved my head yesterday

review.reviewBody: I love the helmet. Although it is expensive, it has great ventilation and looks great. I have used it in Tennessee summers, and my head has been as cool as ever. But the helmet is very expensive for not having any MIPS or other safety features. Also the component/frame which adjusts around your head is a little flimsy and cheap for a $300+ helmet. At times it has fallen off and I have had to reattach it.  Overall it is a great helmet and very cool, but if I was to buy another one, I would buy a Specialized or Giro helmet that includes MIPS and ANGIE (on specialized).
review.name: Great Helmet but Missing Some Things

review.reviewBody: This is my everyday helmet that I bought as an all rounder, and I have a few hundred miles in it now. It wasn?t as comfortable as I was let to believe it would be, but it?s not bad. I think it?s a shape problem and the back of the retention system digging into the back of my head.  Also, the removable cushions tore out the Velcro holding them in place when I removed them to wash. Definitely not something that should happen with a helmet this expensive. Thankfully I managed to stick the Velcro back down, but I?m not sure if this is a real solution yet. At this moment, I feel like the helmet is pretty cool (temp), decently comfortable, semi-aero, but you?re paying mostly for aesthetic with the price as compared to other brands? helmets with equal features.
review.name: Great helmet but not without faults.

review.reviewBody: Super light, comfortable fit. Highly adjustable as I have a lot of hair. Never gets too hot, fits most sunglasses. Almost feels like you're not wearing anything while riding. Research shows that it's extremely safe which is why I purchased initially. Spend the money and get what you deserve to keep you comfortable and safe!
review.name: H Liverpool

name: Protone Helmet

review.reviewBody: My cover is missing all but one of its aglets so I can't zip it up. Very disappointing considering the cost.
review.name: Not what I expected
comment:
Hello, 

Thank you for reaching out. We are really sorry for your issue. Please contact us via this support form to find you the best solution.

https://www.dometic.com/en-us/support/product-support-form#contact-us

Kind regards,
Fanny
Dometic Sales Support

review.reviewBody: I have two dual zone, and they work very well, a little on the heavy side but built to last, I just found out that they have protective covers for them and rather expensive might I add, I just use a pillow and sit on it , it works.
review.name: All you need

review.reviewBody: I put this on today and will be taking our fridge to the desert for a 7 day camp trip.  The quality of the cover appears very good.  It is not as snug a fit as I was expecting, but I think it will be fine.  It will be tied down in my pickup bed inside our canopy, but dust is always an issue in the desert. I think this cover will help.  I could have just wrapped it in a moving blanket I suppose, but this cover will allow us to open and close it while it remains protected.  Looking forward to ice cream at the base of Hart Mountain National Antelope Refuge! Will provide photos and update review after the trip.
review.name: High quality but fits a bit loose

review.reviewBody: Would HIGHLY recommend buying this cover, it protects extremely well from damage caused by friction while traveling (Mine, bought well over a year ago has worn through on the corners due to being a trucker and it rubbing against the edges of my sleeper BUT no damage to my cooler, which I am truly thankful for!) It also helps to keep your food cooler. Protect your investment, this cover is amazing and I'll be definitely buying another!
review.name: Dometic CFX3 PC95

name: CFX3 95 Protective Cover

review.reviewBody:
See how a metal rod poked out of the seat? That's after 5 uses. 

Nothing in me could recommend this less. I'm all about stretching the life of gear, but a required duct-taping is irresponsible product creation. There are zero reasons this product should've broken like this, and other people have similar complaints here too.
review.name: Do not buy: broke after 5 uses

review.reviewBody: This chair was great right up until the third time I used it and the support rod broke through the stitching causing the chair to collapse. Very disappointing for a Kelty product.
review.name: Broke after third use.

hasVariant.name: Tippet Tender Pocket
hasVariant.description: Buy the Simms Tippet Tender Pocket online or shop all Fishing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Great add on piece for that extra tackle and storage and it comes off real easy with the zipper. I use it for surf fishing.
review.name: Surf fishing

review.reviewBody: Little pouch works great. I am not sure why it was not included with the waders I got. Perhaps only some models come with it?
Great for holding little essentials while out on the water. Wish these zip-in pockets would come standard with waders, they're definitely handy!
This is great! I’ve only used it a couple of times so far but will be using it often along with all the other simms products I have and will acquire in the future.
review.name: Keep making great products

review.reviewBody: I keep tippet, tube flies, spare forceps and good luck in this pouch.  Perfect addition to your waders
review.name: It’s the little things

review.reviewBody: Great addition to your waders that should come with an inside pocket to begin with . Simms gear is definitely one of the best when it comes to outdoor fishing gear and waders especially and they're proud of it as you see by the price ... This pouch works well to hold your wallet , leader , small tackle and whatnot , the only down side is that it will continually unzip itself unless you glue( just a drop ) at the end of the zipper . For the cost of this pouch it should work flawlessly and not need added help to make it work ... Gotta have an inside pocket it works thanks to my modification ...
review.name: Not great ...

review.reviewBody: Fits great, holds items well, unzips way too easy.

name: Tippet Tender Pocket

review.reviewBody: I bought these for an upcoming trip after hearing ExOfficio being recommended by many and they live up to the hype! They are very comfortable for every day wear and easy to sink wash and air dry for the next day. I’ll definitely be buying more soon!
review.name: Comfortable and Breathable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I did not have high expectations for wearing this underwear, as I’m usually disappointed in the way underwear fits and wears in general; well that’s not the case here!! This underwear is extremely comfortable and has a “barely there” feel. All through the day, the underwear stays put and does not ride up or down. The underwear material itself is heavenly feeling, no issues with sweat at all; that’s the true test. I need to go buy other colors of this underwear, since it’s part of my routine now! My advice, don’t go buy another piece of underwear that you may or may not like, instead- go buy this one; you won’t regret it!
review.name: Superior comfort for everyday wear

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received this product about a month ago. It is so soft and I love the way it fits for the most part. I have a weird body shape so it tends to ride down just a little. Overall a great product that doesn’t show the typical Pamela on.
review.name: Soft material!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Such great quality and very comfortable too! I love the fit and am excited to add these to my collection! I wasn’t expecting to love them as much as I do, but they’re so great and don’t ride up, which is all you can ask for!
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this underwear. It is so comfortable and provides the coverage for the day and/or night. The best part is when you’re traveling or don’t have access to laundry. The garment can be washed with soap and water and air dry quickly! The neutral color makes this piece wearable with anything.
review.name: So comfortable!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got this a month ago and so far so good. It’s a standard thing and I think it’s more comfortable than other thongs I wear. Not exactly seamless though (not that it was advertised as such). So good for looser pants
review.name: Pretty good

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love these!!!!! And I need to buy more!!!!! They are very comfortable and don’t ride up your booty…. I love the nude color I got and I’m hoping to get more colors…super comfortable and no vpl (visible panty line)
review.name: So comfy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are soft, look great on, and just fit right. But unfortunately they are coming apart and have tiny  holes forming  after one wash! Which is a pretty big bummer because I really wanted to love them!
review.name: Cute but coming apart after one wash
comment:
Thank you for providing us with feedback on our products. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.

We are very sorry to hear that you are experiencing some issues with our product. In order to get a repair assessment or advice, please fill out a Warranty Claim on our website under:

https://www.exofficio.com/warranty-repair.html

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.exofficio.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9 AM - 5 PM EST

Thank you,
ExOfficio Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The ExOfficio - Women's Everyday Thong is very comfortable to wear.  The sizing is on point and the thong stayed in place while wearing.  The sizing remained the same after laundering, and the color held too.
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are my go to underwear to grab each morning. They have a great, breathable fabric. I love that the fabric is sustainable. I can tell these are more moisture wicking than others that I have. These come up higher on my hips than others which is great for my high waisted jeans. They do not roll down or move out of place.
review.name: Favorite daily underwear

name: Everyday Thong Underwear - Women's

hasVariant.name: Aurora 2P Tent: 2-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Aurora 2P Tent: 2-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I love how roomy this tent is, and the material is more heavy duty than a backpacking tent. The zipper is a bit of getting used to but the door opening is very nice.  Tent setup was a head scratcher as I am used to the Jake's foot style.  Rereading the instructions, I wish this was a Jake's foot style setup, which is much more intuitive.
review.name: Great car camping tent

review.reviewBody: I bought this tent about 7 months ago and haves loved it! I’ve used it on many multiple day backpacking trips along with a 12 day trek in New Mexico and I have had absolutely no problems with the tent. Would recommend if your looking for a good durable 2 person tent that can be used a lot.
review.name: Amazing tent!!

review.reviewBody: I love this tent for car camping as one person, for just me. I add a patio pad and fairy lights and it is cozy. I went backpacking this weekend and shared with a friend. It's a little snug with 2 people, but still does the job.
review.name: Great 1p tent

review.reviewBody: It's a perfect tent for car camping, festivals and backpacking trips alike. Roomy interior & fun colors that POP at the campground.
review.name: Massive Interior!

review.reviewBody: only taken it out 3 times but i love it.  Perfect tent if you want to just hangout around camp, bring wayyy to many things with a huge backpack, or sit in a big rain storm and try to make fire.  Held up to rain and snow very well also.
review.name: Love mine

review.reviewBody: After much research, I decided to buy this tent. First time I used, I was amazed by it's size. It's so roomy. I could fit so much inside. And it was easy to set up. However, I was surprised how the net material felt a little cheap, for such a well known brand.First time went well. The second night I was hit by a wind storm so strong that capsized the tent with me, my dog, and all my stuff inside, tossing us onto the bushes. The tent was attached to poles and two rocks, and yet, couldn't resist the wind. After the wind calmed down, the tent was pretty damaged. So many tears and rips. I'm sending the tent to Nemo to see if they can repair it and hope they can. I really like the space in it.
review.name: Not sure about it

review.reviewBody:
So I got this tent through Nemo and absolutely love it for what it is…….a quality campsite or weekend backcountry tent. Yes it is a bit heavy and would not be my first choice for heading to Katahdin but getting lost for a day or two with some whiskey….perfect.

The tent itself is built solid. It has plenty of space for two or maybe three depending on your lifestyle. The vestibules are a good size as well. The interior pockets are where you would want them to be. The included ground sheet is just an added plus in my eyes. They also did good with balancing the mesh to tent tub ratio it’s not to much mesh that it’s just a bug net but really does well in a good storm…I can say that in confidence when I was at Big Meadows last summer. 

Overall this is a great tent for those looking to just get into the game or looking for the perfect weekend tent. 

You can’t beat the price point coming from a name like Nemo too.

My one downside and this is just me complaining about something….the single zipper. I think the new version corrected this but not big enough for me to pass up.
review.name: Great tent for campgrounds or a weekend outing

name: Aurora 2P Tent: 2-Person 3-Season

review.reviewBody: This is a true 5 weight line. When casting a medium to medium fast line it casts easier because it's NOT over-weighted. It's that simple! Of course I also love the color coding which helps keep track of my distance when multiple casts are needed going after a finicky trout in the Delaware system.

review.reviewBody:
Yes, they're a little pricey but I have long, narrow feet; size 13.5 US men's in street shoes and I STRUGGLE finding shoes that fit right. These are perfect for me in a 12.5; I was so happy when I first put them on and climbing on them felt even better.

The toe box is so comfortable I don't mind my toes being a little jammed in at all but these do run large compared to other brands so keep that in mind. They feel good inside, outside, overhanging and even on a longer 5.10 with a slab finish at the top I had zero pain. 

If you have long and narrow feet like me, don't buy anything else for your intermediate shoe.
review.name: My New Favorite All-Round Intermediate

review.reviewBody: These are the most comfortable shoes I've ever climbed in. Like other reviewers, I too have a narrow foot. Normally a size 10.5 in street shoes, bought these in 9/42 and they gave been my go to shoe for two years now. Minimal stretching in that time but definitely some. I've climbed outdoors and indoors on these and even prefer them on long multipitch routes. The toe box is really comfortable with my toes bunched up "just right" and makes edging or precision placements easy. They have held up amazingly well but I take care of my stuff.
review.name: The best

review.reviewBody: I wear a women's US8 in street shoes and ordered a USW7.5/USM6.5 and they fit perfectly. I used to wear a USW7 in these for a tighter fit that also hurt, but feel like the half size up works just as well for performance at the upper amateur level.  They are snug and my toes are pushed close together this way. These shoes are super great for edging on small foot holds because the narrow toe box lets me easily control where my weight goes, and they still retain enough flexibility for larger volumes if you only want to have one shoe. I also feel like the heel is snug and tight enough on my heel for hooks. I do wish there was some more rubber for toe hooking but that would compromise the lacing system that makes these shoes fit like a glove. I have SUPER narrow and low volume feet, and would not recommend these shoes for someone with wide feet.
review.name: Great for edging and narrow feet

review.reviewBody: I’m kind of amazed by how versatile these shoes are. They blend edging power, precision, and sensitivity like no other shoe I’ve worn before. On top of that it’s comfortable enough to wear for quite a while. I usually wear a 12.5 or 13 in street shoes and I got my Tarifas in 10.5. If I bought them again I might go down a half size to a 10 for a super precise fit.
review.name: My new go to

name: Tarifa Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody:
Strap is too long and doesn’t stick well or sticks too well where it isn’t meant to stick which causes fraying on the sides of the bag. 

Two side pockets are open at top and bottom. That works fine if the main pocket is full but once you use a tube that’s in the saddle bag, tension is gone and stuff can fall out. Wanted to like it. Seems like a cool design but just not practical on my gravel bike. Switched it out.
review.name: Doesn’t work well

review.reviewBody:
I was able to pack a tube, 1 Co2 cartridge and valve, tire levers and was able to mount it to my saddle rails. It took a bit of effort at first but once I figured it out, it held on well and tight, good enough for a 100 mile gravel race.  I would bet this would also fit on my mountain bike which has a larger tube, and similar saddle.
I got the tan color ones which was on sale and bonus it matches my tan wall tires perfectly. Only thing is I wish it has a bit more space to fit a multitool.
review.name: Great for gravel bike

review.reviewBody: Picture shows the flap way farther down than where the velcro is. Where it actually closes guarantees everything will fall out. I should have read other reviews!
review.name: Returned

review.reviewBody: It has holes on the the bottom of the least to help things fall out while you ride! Terrible diesen wish I read the reviews. Not worth returning since it costs $7 to return
review.name: Terrible

review.reviewBody:
This though be called the slipper.  Not only does it not have enough velcro to strap to a smaller diameter tube, but the supposed gripper material does little to know gripping.  I think they hay have used anti stick Teflon and butter to make.it.  
Save your money.
review.name: Useless

review.reviewBody:
...it really needs a strap for the bottom to keep it from spinning sideways. I have 2 bottle cages in my triangle so the best spot for it is under the seat facing forwards. If you cinch the strap hard, it stays put for a bit. But after a bit of riding or a hard landing it can spin and you hear your rear tire eating into it.  
As far as the ability to hold recovery gear, its great. Holds a tube, 2 CO2 cartridges, a M20 tool and a couple tire levers with no issue.
But it NEEDS that bottom strap to be 5 stars!
review.name: it's good but...

review.reviewBody: First ride the bag wiggles out of the strap and was just hanging. Nothing secures the bottom side to the strap. Had it tight as I could strap it. Lost my gear. Would be fine for road riding or light gravel.
review.name: Not secure on seatpost MTB

review.reviewBody: Almost returned this and then decided to try it out and have ended up being a fan. Definitely throw some frame protector around where the texturized  part of touched your bike.
review.name: Didn?t care for this at first

review.reviewBody: I have three of these in my family.  Holding a tube and cartridges it stays on well and I haven?t lost anything.  BUT:  it created a wear spot on one of my bikes and has marred a carbon frame!   Beware!
review.name: Can mar your frame!

review.reviewBody: Prepare to lose lots of things you put in the bag.
review.name: Loose. Untrustworthy.

hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Comfort Light Insulated Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
took my comfort lite mat out to the rockies in august this year and had surprisingly great sleep on this thing. when its nice and full it keeps my
hips off the ground which is new for me. spent 4 nights on the ct and was warm and cozy. the pump sac makes it easy to inflate the mat and my aeros xl pillow. i would love a discount code to grab the spark quilt with a liner :) durability is a concern with how lightweight it is but if i can get 2 seasons and a total of 30 nights with it i will be happy with the money spent
review.name: comfy and warm

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love my may. My arthritis makes it hard to roll it up and put it in the bag I wish the bag was just slightly bigger but that's it I really like it
review.name: I love my may. My

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Returning my damaged sleeping mat was incredibly easy with Sea to Summit's return process. Not only did they replace the damaged sleeping mat with a brand new one, but they paid for the return shipping. I am delighted with the customer service I received and very glad that I decided to purchase a Sea to Summit product. I will definitely continue to buy from this company in the future.
review.name: Returning my damaged sleeping mat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a high quality backcountry sleeping mat that inflates with ease and stays inflated!! I can’t say enough about the company, Sea to Summit- they have great customer service and are there to help. I own three different Sea to Summit mats and wouldn’t hike without them. I also carry one in my SAR pack for emergencies.
review.name: Amazing backcountry sleeping mat!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is the second S2S Comfort Light Insulated pad I had had-- the first one began to leak air after ~1 year of use, so after patching I sent it in for repair. I was told that the pad had a (rare) manufacturing defect that couldn't be fixed and was promptly sent a new one. This one holds air fine so far (I've had it and used it consistently for ~3 months). It's a comfortable pad, quiet, and feels like a soft mattress. I think it's the most comfortable for back sleepers and those who prefer a plusher mattress in "frontcountry" life. My partner has a backpacking pad from another company that feels firmer and would maybe be preferable to a side sleeper, but this one is warm, comfortable, and at least this one appears to be fairly durable. I like the inflation using the air sac-- it is so much quicker than mattresses that need to be inflated by mouth. It does tend to slide around a little bit on the bottom of the tent compared to other mattresses-- I wonder if future versions of this mat could have a slightly grippier material on the bottom to prevent that from happening.
review.name: comfy pad for back sleepers

review.reviewBody: I was very happy with the pad as long as it was inflated. Sadly one night the seam (laminated) just opened and I found myself sleeping on the ground. Tried to fix it, but the hole just grew bigger.
review.name: It was good..

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable, relatively quiet, and the integrated pump sack is really convenient. I would give it 5 stars but it’s a little bit bulky. The trade off for comfort is worth it though.
review.name: Very comfortable, relatively quiet, and

review.reviewBody: I wish that it was wider. Had a tendency to roll off of it while sleeping on my side.
review.name: I wish that it was

review.reviewBody: This sleeping mat by Seatosummit is a really great mat. It is comfortable, warm and easy to inflate. My issues are not with this product specifically but with all mats in general. It is Very noisy to sleep on when turning in your sleep. So much so I try not to move so not to wake up people in other tents. Another issue with mats in general is they are very slick and slide out from underneath you while your sleeping or if your tent isnt perfectly level the mat and you included will slide down the slightest bit of decline imaginable. I would like to see Seatosummit address these issues that were unexpected in a high end sleeping mat.
review.name: Really nice mat, but lacking.

review.reviewBody: I always like to wait until I've used items like this multiple times before I write a review so I can be sure to really road test it. When I first received these sleeping pads, I was leery about how thin and lightweight the material was and was concerned they would puncture easily or otherwise be fragile, and I was also concerned they wouldn't be as comfortable as my older (and more bulky) pads. I have now used them on several backpacking and car camping trips and have found they are totally durable and are without a doubt the most comfortable pads I have ever slept on. It is amazing how light they are and how small they are when stowed and I am absolutely amazed with how comfortable they are - I'm in my late 50's and have used lots of pads over the years and these are the best. I couldn't be more pleased. I really like how the pillow attaches to the pad and I like how I can fill them up with the stuff sack, although it is a bit challenging to get the stuff sack to open up fully so it is full of air for filling purposes...only a minor thing but the one aspect I'd suggest they work on improving for those times it's really cold or otherwise you want to fill up the pad quickly. Thanks again - I'm thoroughly impressed and pleased and my back thanks you.
review.name: Hands Down Best Sleeping Pad Ever

name: Comfort Light Insulated Sleeping Pad
Comfort Light Insulated Sleeping Pad

hasVariant.description: Buy the Reserve Fillmore Valves online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I have a pair of these for over a year and they never get clogged unlike the regular valves and they are way better for air flow to be able to put on new tubeless tires. They are really expensive but comfort has its price.
review.name: Way better than the standard valves

review.reviewBody: I bought these on the claim of ease of tubeless set up. I could not get sealant to flow through the valve as they claimed. Since there is no valve core to remove you have to insert sealant through the edge of an unseated tire. Tubeless set up messy and harder. Can’t think of a reason to purchase these especially at a significant premium to other great valves.
review.name: Expensive

review.reviewBody: Easy to put sealant in and release air.  so far so good no leaking air.
review.name: New intervention

review.reviewBody: A lot of people buy these to avoid clogging, that’s not something I previously experienced. I like these so much for the ease of adjust air pressure. So sweet!
review.name: Awesome!!

review.reviewBody:
I installed these on my primary wheels for my gravel bike a year ago.
Two months later I installed them on my 650b wheels after loving how they work.
And now the commuter gets these valves.
The design is much better than a presta with much more air going into the tire and much less clogging at the valve.
Contrary to comments below, you can add sealant through the valves and it looks, from the reserve wheels website, that they have added a 70mm and 90mm valves to the existing 50cm valves for those with deeper wheels.
review.name: Love them

review.reviewBody: These are obviously solid stems (but be careful) - they are so stout that if you side them on a rock you could easily damage the rim hole.  However, I am returning them for another obvious reason that I should have seen before buying. You cannot add sealant by removing the center and hooking up your Stans Bottle device.  VERY inconvenient.  Buyer beware
review.name: Not good for adding sealant

review.reviewBody:
These are listed at 50MM, but that's all in. In reality, by the time you add in the red cone the short thread stack, they are closer to 25-30mm. 

For reference sake, I'm using Winspace Lun gravel wheels, which are listed at 38mm deep. The valves are so short I couldn't even thread the lock nut. 

Bummer, but I think these would be way easier to use than traditional valves.
review.name: Way, way too short

review.reviewBody: If you want to seat new tubeless tires easily, this is the way. I can imagine price around $30 range, but I do still think it was a good investment. I wish they would make road bike compatible too for the deep dishes.
review.name: No more hassle

review.reviewBody: Wanted to give someone heads up if they're buying these for their TRS 249 Reynolds rims.  The 50mm stem was NOT long enough, so don't buy these stems until they offer longer stems.  I purchased these stems b/c I've had (2) friends tires go so flat at the trail head that the old presta stems wouldn't take air via Ryobi air-pump and had to drive to a gas station / bike shop.  Of course we could have use C02 but then we'd have to change out our sealant later. So if these new Reserve Stems save me one time, it's worth it!  But yeah, wish they were only $ 38 for the pair.
review.name: Not long enough for TRS 249 Reynold rims

review.reviewBody: It's true you can set up a tubeless tire very easily with just a floor pump when you have these installed.  At least the two I did, no issues at all.  The design makes a lot of sense when you actually have them in your hands.  Makes you think you should have came up with this idea, it's just a much better way to get air in a tire and keep it there.  Dropping a psi or two mid ride or where ever is slightly easier than a traditional valve too, no core to unthread
review.name: Really easy to setup

name: Fillmore Valves

review.reviewBody: I love my Merrells, been wearing them for decades and currently have about 5 pairs. I also like hearing about the sales BUT, why do you send me 5 emails everyday along with text messages? Opting out AGAIN.

review.itemreviewed: Chameleon 8 Stretch Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: The concrete construction site visits. Excellent fit, grip, waterproof. Yes!
review.name: Great

review.itemreviewed: Chameleon 8 Stretch Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Cool shoe, definitely 100% waterproof, but can lead to your feet overheating. I ordered slightly too big and dealt with some heel slippage, but not a big deal. The traction is also not fantastic on slippery surfaces like wet concrete.
review.name: Chamelon

review.itemreviewed: Chameleon 8 Stretch Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I just got mine today. They were a little hard to get on on, but I managed to make it work. They are a tad tight up around the tounge area, but I'm sure they will loosen up a bit the more I wear them. Overall I like the way they feel and I can tell I'm a little bit faster today Lol
review.name: Snug, but comfy!

review.itemreviewed: Chameleon 8 Stretch Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Comfortable and confident on dirt trails and pavement.  However, my socks and feet were quite wet after 5 hours in the rain.  Removed the insoles and used a hair dryer to get ready for the next day.  Dissappointed they got so wet.
review.name: Great shoe but not waterproof

review.itemreviewed: Chameleon 8 Stretch Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I wear these nearly every day when birding. I grab my MOABs for more rugged or strenuous excursions, but my Chameleons are perfect for all-terrain walks and leisurely hikes. Also a great all-purpose "pack light" shoe to travel with if I need to split everyday wear with outdoor activity while taking up minimal space. The waterproofing isn't full-force (I wouldn't ford a stream or trek through heavy rain or standing water and expect to stay dry) but it's enough to get you through wet grass, light mud, and the occasional puddle. And considering my sweaty feet, these are surprisingly breathable.

There are a few small negatives, but no dealbreakers. The laces are far longer than necessary and the closure clip is junky, but I just cut them down and replaced with a better clip I bought for a few bucks. The seam where the tread meerts the front of the toe began to separate at the top, but I filled it with shoe goo. Finally, on occasion something happens that causes the sole under the ball of my foot to feel lumpy and uneven, and I have to kind of massage the shoe to even it out.

A size note: I usually wear 9.5W in Merrells; since these don't come in wide width, I got them in 10.5, and those fit perfectly.
review.name: My Go-To "Light Hikers"

review.itemreviewed: Chameleon 8 Stretch Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: These are my go to hiking shoes. Put 1000+ miles a year on them. Literally wear them till the sole is worn out. Wear well and are extremely comfortable. Love the no tie system. Have had probably 10 pairs. Best hiking shoes I have ever had.
review.name: Best hiking shoes ever.

name: Chameleon 8 Stretch Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: I Purchased this tent for a single camper. I wanted something large enough for myself. The tent is super easy to set-up. There are a few good YouTube videos that will guide you on how to set it up. The reasons I went with this tent are the 3 doors for lots of airflow and the Big Agnes name brand. I chose Backcountry because of the price and reputation. I only used the  tent once so far in a VERY hot day in May (Texas) and it was great to lay down and watch the sky through the tent. I didn't use the rainfly, but tested it at home. It is also very easy to setup. The color coded straps help a lot with setting-up the tent. I do wish that the tent came with the footprint at this price point, but most tents don't include a footprint  So far there are not cons.
review.name: Great Tent!

review.reviewBody: There’s nothing more in a paddle kayak you that you could possibly need. I like to stand and I wanted room without peddles or a console getting in my way. This kayak gives me  so much room and stability that I can stand and turn around with no issues. Fly fishing is no problem either with extra room gained from eliminating the console. This creates a all the room you need for stripping line without the worry of your fly line getting tangled. I would recommend this kayak for anyone.

description: Buy the Blackburn Wayside Multi-Tool online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Wayside Multi-Tool
hasVariant.description: Buy the Blackburn Wayside Multi-Tool online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Great tool. I've kept it in my saddle bag for seven years now. Detaching allen keys make it so much easier to use because you can fit into tight spaces easier, get the torque that you need while avoiding stripping holt heads. speaking of which, one end of the hex keys are balled to make it easier to loosen things after you've got the bolt initially loosened. The hex keys fit into the 8mm hex to act as cheater bar and help w grip when it is tight. 

only wishes is that it came w a T10, the 6, 8 keys came out, and maybe it had a philips head for that odd hardware attachment.
review.name: Great tool. detaching hex are awesome

review.reviewBody: The tool is a nice way to have everything I could use on a trail side fix, unfortunately the tabs that hold the Allen wrenches on broke and now the only way to keep them on is with a rubberband. I?m going back to a fold out tool.
review.name: Tool is great...until it breaks

review.name: Size chart off on this product

review.reviewBody: I just bought it. I wished I ordered the 7” long. Nice shorts though.
review.name: Great shorts

review.reviewBody: I was trying to find a light weight, easy to clean (dry quickly) short to take on a trip to Italy. I wanted to pack light so I was looking for a short that didn’t wrinkle, was durable, not cheap looking and would dry quick. This short checked all those boxes. I ordered several colors in 2 sizes to make sure I got the right size. You can see through the lighter colors so I ended up getting the darker blue and black. I have thick girl thighs and the length was just long enough to be comfortable walking in the heat of Rome, but short enough to be cute and not look like “mom” shorts. I bought 3 pair since I know they will last!
review.name: Buying more!  Great summer and travel short!

review.reviewBody: I own 8 of these! They fit perfectly, are very comfortable and pretty wrinkle free. I can easily wear them for 3 days and they still look good.
review.name: Great Fit

review.reviewBody: I love the material, but DO NOT PURCHASE the COOL GREY color. They are transparent. I am returning them.
review.name: Cool Grey is Transparent. . .

review.reviewBody: Fit as expected. Great color, light fabric and not that stiff feeling that some fabrics have. Very comfy! But I absolutely hate the buttons on this short, they are very hard to button/unbutton.
review.name: Light fabric, comfortable

review.reviewBody: These are for flat butts. Not for women with any kind of shape.
review.name: Not for curves

name: Coral Point III 5in Short - Women's

description: Buy the Osprey Packs Sojourn 80L Rolling Gear Bag online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Sojourn 80L Rolling Gear Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Sojourn 80L Rolling Gear Bag online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought a 60L Sojourn Wheeled travel pack for my wife to test the design and it exceeded all of our expectations. I just purchased the 80L for myself. We are taking them to Europe for about 3 months next year.

This is a for real backpack!! It wouldn't be my first choice to take into the back country but I could if it was all I had. The suspension, straps and waste belt perform just like a regular internal frame pack. I can also take a small daypack and strap it into the external synch straps when in backpack mode or stack it on top when dragging it in roller bag mode. 

When stowed for roller bag mode the large wheels and rugged design work great on uneven surfaces. It will probably do fine on cobblestones but if not, it only takes me three minutes to convert to a pack.

The interior pockets are also well thought out. My wife used hers for about 2 months on a road trip and it was easy to keep things organized. 

While not cheap it is a super good deal when you look at the performance, features and the "All Mighty Guarantee"! Osprey can afford to do that because they build packs that don't fail. We are still using Osprey backcountry packs that are 25 years old and going strong.
review.name: I bought a 60L Sojourn

review.reviewBody: I returned this pack because the backpack straps take up entirely too much room. I compared it in person to the design of the 100L duffel without the backpack straps, and the difference if very substantial If you're buying a 60L or 80L rolling duffel, you will very, very rarely find yourself using the backpack straps. If Osprey made the 60L or the 80L with the 100L's and 130L's non-backpack design, I would but it in an instant. The Soujourn bags are VERY well built. I own the 46L travel pack and it has held up to a lot of abuse. It's too bad that Sojourn designed the 60L and 80L duffels for the sliver of users that would want backpack straps on a bag that size.
review.name: The backpack straps take up too much room

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I've used various versions of the bag and they are incredibly durable and the double compression strap design adds to the ruggedness. Would really like to see a version without the backpack straps though, so that space on the back could be added to the interior. It's 80L total but some of the space isn't very usable since the back pocket with the straps is included so compared to other 80L bags, it's less spacious considering its external dimensions.
review.name: I've used various versions of

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this bag! It is extremely well built and a great option for travelers wanting more size than some of the backpacks designed with minimalism in mind. The wheels are smooth and the backpack carry option is comfortable. I’m 6 feet tall and it fits great, but I do imagine it being a little large and bulky on the back for someone shorter. My only wish is that there was a way to secure the outside straps when they are cinched down so they aren’t flapping around while being in checked luggage.
review.name: Love this bag! It is

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] After some long travel this season, my only complaint is that the buckles on the straps (when zipped in and away) create a pressure point and when the bag is checked, there is visible wear and tearing on those points. I try to keep everything flat and those tucked away when checking the bag. I don’t think it will break through but Im keeping an eye on it. Other than that, we love it.
review.name: After some long travel this

review.reviewBody: Bought it and immediately returned it. I wanted a rolling pack that I can easily throw on my shoulders when needed. This pack requires that you use the waist belt (no way around it) and spend at least a couple minutes setting up all the straps every single time you want to throw it on your shoulders. And you need to do the reverse to get it back to its rolling state. It’s too bad, because except for the terribly designed handle release, I like the actual pack.
review.name: Inconvenient

review.reviewBody: i just bought one of these from a local shop and brought it home. Paid full retail for it as i could go and try the 60 and the 80. Couldn't fit what I used to put in my old Eddie Bauer 26 into the 60 so I went with the 80. Got it home and was working with the back pack straps and getting that set up. I pulled on one of the chest straps - and it broke off of where it was connected. Really? Not sure the design was though through really well - or perhaps no one actually tried it? Well, it broke. Now I have to take it back and swap for another or have it fixed. So, my comment to you Osprey is this is a real weakness that is small - but will bring aggravation to those who use the backpack option. I know, it has the almighty warranty, but as i understand it, that almighty warranty isn't so almighty if I have to send this in and have to pay shipping. That can be spendy.
review.name: seems to be durable, but not?

name: Sojourn 80L Rolling Gear Bag
